Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Nillisi
Reviews.Content: We were on a romantic Easter getaway, staying at this hotel for three nights. We just loved it! A very nice, quiet location close to the metro-station, nice pub next door, bakeries and many restaurants close by. Our room was not big, but had space enough, and the bed was fantastic. Also enjoyed the bathtub and Nespresso machine. The room was very quiet and we slept very well. Staff was nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “very romantic boutique hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: LorelaiCH
Reviews.Content: This sexy property is a small boutique hotel in a great location in Paris, just 10 min walk from the very busy Champs Elyse. We had the junior suite, that we HIGHLY recommend. The furniture is very modern, the bed is comfortable but what is the most amazing is that they have the best tub in the world! the breakfast is nice and very french, the staff is nice and helpful and overall,is great. enjoy Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon at a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: FoodieMD2015
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two weeks for our honeymoon last June 2011. It was absolutely fantastic. ROOMS: Yes, the rooms are small but we expected that from a European hotel. Our room actually had a large balcony that we sat on almost daily to have coffee or wine and cheese and of course, baguette. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are very fashionably decorated. It also had a sense of privacy which was great considering this was a romantic trip. We never heard noise from the hallway or from neighboring rooms. It was like we were in our own little world. Also, the curtains on the windows to our balcony blocked out all light when they were closed which made for a restful sleep. STAFF: We also never were too bothered by any staff or maids, etc. Sometimes we feel staff can be overbearing but here it was just right. The staff was very helpful when we did need them. They helped us book a semi-private tour to the wine country. They also helped us with dinner reservations. We asked them for a restaurant recommendation and they asked us what we were looking for and they called up and made us a reservation right on the spot. They gave us advice on which trains to take for where we were going. We are huge Disney fans and they also helped us buy tickets for Disneyland. All of the staff was very friendly and seemed to go out of their way to help us during our stay. BONUSES: It was a bit rainy when we went and the hotel has free umbrellas for you to take with you during the day. This was great as we didn't think to bring umbrellas! The hotel also provides free wi-fi which was great for checking airline reservations the day before we were leaving. There are free movie channels on the TV in multiple languages. I adored the shower head. It was one of those rainfall ones, very luxurious. The beds were super comfortable. We always woke feeling rested. One night, we stopped and bought some desert at a little bakery and when we got to our room we realized we needed plates and forks. We called and they sent them up in no time. Also, when the maids clean the rooms, they leave little cards with the next day's weather forecast and they also leave little chocolates on the pillows. :) FOOD: I agree with other reviewers that the breakfast was very pricey even for Paris...so guess what? We just skipped it (can I just say this is common sense? If you feel something is overpriced, why buy it? plus in our experience, hotel breakfasts aren't much to write home about anyway) If you walk literally to the next corner, there is a fantastic cafe (which was recommended by hotel staff!). We ate breakfast there every day. The service was superb and they got to know us over the two weeks we were there. The food was fantastic!! In your room as well or in the common area there is free coffee and tea which was nice. LOCATION: Good location, we never felt out of the loop. We walked to the Eiffel Tower on our first day so that we could see the sights as we walked. It was a bit of a long walk, but a very nice one. Once we got the hang of Paris, it was very easy to take the train everywhere. Overall, we would stay here again when we return to Paris. A lovely hotel, and definitely deserves the 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL AND SERVICE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bconnery21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from Paris today and I wanted to tell everyone about what a nice service I received at this hotel. The rooms are small but contemporary and close to everything including the Arc de Triomphe. The service was personal and just plain five star. The location cannot be beat for having RER and regular metro service one block away which can whiz you to most tourist and central areas in Paris. There was no rude staff to be said and they were very understanding and helpful in getting us in the right direction. What I can say is that this is Paris and it is to be expected that the french are proud of their language and culture. When in Paris just go and enjoy this hotel it is worth the money! Also, the beds were very comfortable and with my bad back I hold my hand on the bible when I say it was heavenly for both myself and my wife. We are both discerning travelers and if I say it was worth it then it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay which was sadly ruined.”
Reviews.Author: Andrea F
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this as a surprise, romantic weekend for my 40th birthday. The hotel is located down a side road and what a hidden gem we thought we had found. All the staff that we met were attentive, polite and nothing was enough trouble. Our room was beautiful, we noticed that some rooms had balconies but were told that these rooms were smaller, I suppose it's what you prefer. We were impressed with the fact that many of the movies in the room were free, having recently stayed in the Savoy in London and being charged £12 for a film we were pleased that this hotel did not exploit this service.On our first night we were recommended to a most wonderful restaurant, located in a square and within easy walking distance of the hotel. We are both big "foodies" and have eaten in many fine dining restaurants, our meal was one of the best we have ever had, the place had a relaxed rustic charm and the food was sensational!!! I must also mention Stephane and Chris who were both delightful and helpful throughout our stay. Sadly our wonderful stay was ruined upon our return home. I had left behind a pair of boots and trousers, the boots were returned to me but after numerous phone calls and emails the trousers have not been returned. The only conclusion I can come to is that a member of staff has taken them which is totally unacceptable for a small luxury hotel. I hasten to add that my trousers were very unusual and expensive and were my birthday present from my children. I find it appalling that someone can take something that does not belong to them and I hope that the person reads this review and realises the impact it has on the hotel. I feel sorry for all the other members of staff who are working so hard to maintain the high level of customer service, I unfortunately felt I could not give the hotel a high rating. My advice to you if you do decide to stay here is to check your room thoroughly before you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Daniel K
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel in Paris, or any capital city for that matter, that offers convenience, reasonable pricing and quality in equal measure is a complex equation to solve. Usually one factor will override the others and you will be left feeling one factor is significantly lacking. Not so at Les Jardins de la Villa, it epitomises everything a small capital hotel should be: - Convenient, a few minutes from the AF buses that run frequently to CDG and Porte Maillot metro station. - Pricing, my room was 25% lower than other 4* hotels (Le Meridien Etoile, et al.) and when you’re staying a for a few weeks the difference is massive. - Quality, absolutely 1st class. The interior of the hotel and rooms is some of the best I have seen outside of 5* hotels. He attention to detail is meticulous. The room was on the small side but beautifully designed and decorated, the lounge and bar area were excellent and the honesty bar had a good selection of drinks and snacks. The room was completely sound proof and excellent curtains completely shut out the spring sunshine when needed. - Staff, all great and happy to help. Alexander at the desk was especially helpful and one of the best hotel employees I have encountered. In summary I can highly recommend Les Jardins de la Villa. The small hotel feel only adds to the experience. The only negatives I would make are: - Breakfast was a little pricey (27 Euros) considering all I really wanted was a coffee and croissant. - Complimentary Internet access was slow and occasionally disconnected. I would have preferred a pay option for faster and stable speeds. Really minor issues in the grand scheme of things.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel near the 1 metro line”
Reviews.Author: benjhobbs
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I are so happy that we decided to stay at this hotel. The room is finished impeccably and is beautiful, even the bathroom amenities smell great. The staff were all very friendly (even for Parisian standards), and the room was always kept very clean. We didn't eat at the hotel at all, so we can't comment on that. The honesty bar is a very nice idea, but we didn't take advantage of that either. The location of the hotel is wonderful. It's on a quieter street, but is only a short walk from the 1 metro line, so it makes it easy to get to all of Paris's main attractions. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to people that like a trendier, clean and very comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible! 5 starss!”
Reviews.Author: tgardner18
Reviews.Content: Im not sure where to start here. there is no much going on here im more afraid of leaving something out!. Let me start by saying THE STAFF!! they are polite, attentive and informative. No request is too small and they are quick to respond. The level of service started BEFORE i ever arrived!. I expressed concerns about my credit card as it has been stolen in the past so i dont like using it unless i can see the person taking it. They heard my concerns and held my room anyway!, Room 47-EXCELLENT They have changed my view of small boutique hotels. The rooms: expresso maker, towel warmer, robes, slippers, sewing kits, ANYTHING YOU NEED. Turn-down service each evening with chocolates, pillow spray and the next days weather report. The lobby has free coffee, tea and an amazing honesty bar.Two computers to use with free wifi and printing. I agree that you should skip the breakfast... too much for too little but thats all hotels really. The location is good for walking to the subway and Champs Elysees. and its only 2 blocks from the subway. Im still scared i missed something... its neat, clean, classy, has exceptional amenities and an amazing staff!. I will not stay anywhere else!! Thank you to the staff and management!

Reviews.Title: “Never staying anywhere else in Paris again”
Reviews.Author: gigantocypris
Reviews.Content: I am really reluctant to write this review, because I understand that a good review on Tripadvisor = more chances of the hotel being booked = less chances of last-minute availability for myself when I decide to make my spontaneous trips to Paris... However, it was such a great stay for such a ridiculously good price. I owe Les Jardins de la Villa this review. I am usually not a fan of contemporary interiors (I prefer the outdated 18th century French look - haha), but Les Jardins de la Villa is adorable! The photos on the website are accurate representations of what the hotel itself looks like. There are a lot of seats and sofas in the lobby lounge, with a bar that opens until very late. You get free, unlimited coffee and tea! The tea comes in these cute pyramid-shaped bags. The concierge was so nice and left the bar open past midnight just to cater to my caffeine addiction. They also have books, newspapers, and two computers with internet available. Walk past the bar, and you will be led to the entrance of the small garden with seats where you can enjoy a little cigarette or drink. The rooms are definitely small - that is probably the only real complaint that I have. However, the interiors are beautiful and the beds are so comfortable (no excruciatingly soft mattresses like most hotels). The bathrooms are very photogenic, and towels are left on a heating rack for you. They leave you chocolate, the weather report, pillow spray, and other goodies for you every night! Other pros: -The wireless internet is free! However, the signal may be weaker in the rooms. -The service is impeccable and the staff are all very friendly! -The hotel is only a 10-15 minute walk away from the Arc de Triomphe (and Charles de Gaulle Etoilé Station) Tips: -Breakfast is not worth it... 28euros with a small selection of food. You're better off running to the market right across the street and bringing some breakfast back, since the coffee here is free anyway. -Take advantage of their wonderful lobby lounge I don't think I could stay anywhere else in Paris. This has been my best experience so far!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: alex966
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 2-night stay in Paris. Everything positive written by previous reviewers about Les Jardins de la Villa is 100% true. Great location (metro, Air France shuttle bus station for transfers to/from the CDG airport, Champs d'Elysee), attractive interiors, cosy rooms, very attentive and caring staff (the biggest asset of the hotel!) being very fluent in English, adequate breakfast, adequate price/quality ratio. I will not waste my time next time planning a trip to Paris by going through dozens of reviews of the city's hotels. The choice is very simple and clear for me now - Les Jardins de la Villa.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SkerryMaisie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the first weekend in March and were really impressed from start to finish! The rooms are lovely, nicely decorated but it is the friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff which impressed us the most. They were able to recommend and reserve fantastic restaurants for us, order taxis etc and were always pleasant to talk to. The waitress serving breakfast was really nice and served us breakfast even though we were a little late down. Breakfast is extremely expensive there though so we only ate there once and if you venture out you wil find a number of brasseries offering much cheaper alternatives. Location of the hotel is great, right across the street from the airport bus stop and walking distance from the Arc de Triomphe/Champs Elysees. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! - Beware of Special Offer”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to this hotel on the 3rd weekend in February and really did enjoy our stay. The facilities and general attention to detail were second to none. The staff I found to be generally helpful. This is a stylish yet quaint hotel that is nice to come back to once you have spent the day sightseeing. My only complaint concerns the booking of the room itself through the hotels website. I have since simulated a booking to check that what I am telling you is accurate: I was initially seduced by the free breakfast special offer. When you use this link, be absolutely sure that you have the free breakfast included in your rate once the website takes you through the booking procedure. I booked a Deluxe Room over a weekend for 450EUR having navigated through the special offer screen. It wasn't obvious on the confirmation page that the special offer had been included. I therefore added additional comments pertaining to the breakfast offer when given the opportunity - these comments requested the hotel to confirm by email that the free breakfast was included. The comments were also added to my final confirmation printout. I forgot all about the booking until the weekend in question. When I arrived at the hotel I queried the offer with the evening staff who said they would check. We took breakfast on the saturday morning but not on the sunday as we were time constrained. When we came to check out - surprise surprise the breakfast was not included. The hotel weren't giving any concessions when I discussed this with them and I did not want an arguement - so paid. I will add that the breakfast is very expensive, so do confirm and perhaps make your booking by phone to ensure you are able to clarify at the time of deposit payment. There is a nice restaurant around the corner which is far cheaper and it would have been nice to have that option in mind. I will add that the crisps from the minibar are the most expensive on the planet at 8EUR a bag! However, this was only a mild souring to an otherwise hitch free trip!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tariq S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Superb service with immediate availability of the staff when required Room was slightly on the smaller side but very cosy, also the attached small balcony compensated well for this. The hotel is 2 minutes walk from Palais de Congres the conference venue and Porte Maillot metro station which provide easy and quick link to the city centre and other attractions. It is only a pleasant 15 minute walk from Arc de Triomph. Close to the hotel are several good and traditional restaurants. This hotel was a very pleasant surprise to me and my wife who accompanied me. Although he rooms were on the small side they were very cosy and the very uniquely decorated and comfortable lobby was virtually next door this was manned by very friendly staff and had a 'honesty bar' attached to it with free coffee and tea available at all times. The decor of the hotel was unique perhaps almost psychadellic. It is a very quiet and extremely comfortable hotel with the most helpful and friendly staff which made our stay ver comfortable and memorable. Caution: Be careful of the pick pockets in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful base for our short stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LeoAfricanus110
Reviews.Content: Our one night stay at the Hotel les Jardins de la Villa was tremendous. Our welcome was swift, friendly and efficient and the staff were attentive and accomodating throughout our stay (theyrecommended a great local bistro - Le Ballon des Ternes - for lunch on the day of departure and even provided a travel plug adapter as we had forgotten ours). The hotel itself is a brief walk from Porte Maillot metro station (situated on Line 1; approx 20 mins from Gare du Nord). In all fairness the walk to the Arc de Triomphe from the hotel is more than managable too. There's a lovely Eric Kayser artisan boulangerie along the way to pick up your early morning croissant or pliande chocolate from too. The hotel is situated in a seemingly affluent part of the city and we felt very safe returning back to the hotel late at night. Our only gripe was something mentioned by another guest: the water from the shower leaked under the glass door causing some minor drama but nothing an extra set of towels couldn't deal with. The in-room Nespresso machine was a nice touch as was the hammam/sauna facility. The beds were very comfy, toiletries were nice and the card informing us of the next day's weather as well as the aromatherapy sleep spray all added to the allure of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoTravelHappy
Reviews.Content: Great amenities here, with excellent breakfast and tea options. Close to transportation. Rooms are small, but rooms tend to be small in Paris. We only wish the staff was more accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: wildmandxb
Reviews.Content: This is one of the newly refurbished boutique hotels of Paris. Its rooms are very elegant, though on the small side hence i do recommend staying in their suites. They offer free WIFI, they have an honesty bar which came in very handy. They have a small garden to enjoy. It is 10 min walking to the famous champs elysee. Dont worry about what other reviewers mentioned regarding the location. This is Paris for god's sake, there is a metro station right next to the hotel, you can use it to access any where you would like to go. The Concierge at the hotel is very helpfull, he went out of his way and called many restaurants around paris to find us a suitable location to spend valentines day there. Thank you so much for such an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bouteque hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunseeker-England
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very cute and unique in style. Upon arrival we were greeted by a friendly receptionist who spoke excellent English! We had booked a standard (termed superior) room. I had read some reviews stating that these rooms were somewhat small so I wasn't expecting much space, however I was pleasantly surprised. Although certainly not huge the room was plenty big enough to store our luggage and move around comfortably. The LCD tv and modern style of the room were great and the free coffee machine was a nice addition. The bathroom was also modern in style and pretty luxurious, with toiletries and bathrobes provided. The only problem we had at all within the room was the shower. It was great to use but wet the majority of the bathroom floor hence the footing of toilet remained wet after you had showered, a poor design. Apart from this we were extremely happy with the room on the whole. The only other gripe was the rate we paid did not include breakfast and this was €29 each as an extra!! Very steep for a continental breakfast. This was not a huge problem however as we tended to eat in a local restaurant for approx €15 each. We didn't use the facilities such as the gym or sauna so couldn't comment as we didn't have the time - but all of the communal areas were luxurious so I would imagine they were good. The location was pretty good too - the metro is only a few minutes walk and it's on the line which takes you to hotel de ville ( town hall with open air ice rink) - a great experience! A short walk from there to notre dame - a must see - within a lovely district. Also easy to get to the champs élysées and louvre museum. Overall would recommend and would return to this hotel of we were to revisit Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a superb location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I stayed here for a long weekend and the hotel really was everything we had hoped for and more!! From the moment we arrived to when we checked out, the friendly staff were always on hand to deal with any request and did everything they possibly could to ensure our stay was perfect! We arrived at midday, and despite being told at the time of booking, that our room would not be available until 2pm, they managed to bring this forward so that we could check in straight away. The room itself was full of all the amenities you would hope for, with our own Nespresso coffee machine a great touch. The bathroom was very modern and the huge walk in shower was just great. The location of the hotel is great, situated in a quiet side street away from the main road and only a 15 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe. There is a taxi rank at the end of the street and the nearest metro station, Port Maillot, is only 150 metres from the hotel, providing easy access to the entire city. Jardins de la Villa really did tick all the boxes and I cannot recommend it enough! Can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing decor, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JGaituah
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in a junior suite, the decor was amazing, the bathroom exquisite and the bed super-soft. The staff were very friendly and suggested a lovely restaurant for dinner, all in all I would definitely visit again. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “STUNNING!!! In one word, very close to perfection!”
Reviews.Author: MikePM
Reviews.Content: Ouah, this is one of the best hotel I have ever stayed in Paris for years....and yes taking into account 5 stars!!!! From the website it felt slightly "over the top" or should I say "kitsch"....but hey let's give it a go. Not only the hotel is well located but you also have plenty of excellent restaurants nearby. The Main facade is nice and discreet (located in a narrow street you can easy miss it unless you know the address....but I guess this is also part of the charm of this superb "boutique hotel". With only 33 rooms, a small but super efficient and friendly front desk a waiting area (kind of fashion if not a bit too trendy), the lounge is spotless with an excellent selection of books and magazines (including the Hermes Scarf latest's book, and plenty of excellent books about Paris, luxury brands and craftsmanship...as well as a couple of computer, smooth music and some well design lightning....next you have the breakfast area, small but with a good layout, very functional and surprisingly very comfortable. You also have a nice outside gardens for smokes or fresh air at the back..... As for the room, again, been very fussy about even the smallest details I have to admit that it was above my expectations, on all level. First the doors, lock and all surface and finish including the lighting are just top notch! The room aren't too big but you really get an Homy feeling with the right things at the right place. Not to mention the Half bottle of Champagne eon Ice (Pierrier Jouet) with a couple of glasses and a large selection of superb "macaron la duree"....Ouah! The bathroom was also top of the range, with some superb Grohe Fixture, a massive, deep bath from Duravit, not too mention the French towel radiator from Acova! you even get the feeling of top quality on the Hotel sleepers, what can I say! It is also worth mentioning that the bathroom was very well decorated, with a fragrance Green tea floating in the air) The Bed was set up ready with a bottle of Lavender Spray for a good night sleep in the pillow (aromatherapy) and a couple of chocolates too. The Air con is good and you can open the windows in Full, the street is pretty quiet and the bed quite good (Not hard enough to my taste, but still excellent). The entire room is full of plugs and switch all from Legrand (the Celiane top of the range), though very nice I found it quite hard to get use to the multiple lighting combination.....I guess I should have stay a few more nights... Obviously you get free internet and a good Samsung TV....a large Minibar selection....and I almost forget a ready Professional Nespresso Machine in every room. I would only point out that depending on the room you might get a small wardrobe with only a few shelves (some rooms are equipped with a complete stand alone wardrobe with plenty of space (but those tend to have a walking shower instead of the bath). Finally The following morning I had a good breakfast, with again top of the range designer tems from the Tea pot to the salt and pepper from Alessi, not to mention the good music background from Classical to groovy ambiance from the complete Bose sound system....the cheese selection is superb, not to mention the excellent tea selection..though you may find that the overall selection is not as large in term of Fruits and other hot dishes (you do have the usual Bacon and Scramble eggs of course). And last but no least the service is discreet, efficient and still very friendly....just as it should be from the cleaning Dept to the Front Desk and Breakfast staff......a real treat! Finally, and to resume I still can't believe how they manage to have it just right with the decoration in every corners, using designers items, mixing style and fabrics it might looks kitsch but it is actually a very dicey exercise with great quality products...they nailed it!!! Creating a real home feeling and cosiness rarely achieve in an hotel those days. Clearly "small is beautiful" and they got it right! Superb. Good points: + Staff, service, attention to details. + No short cut in the quality of materials throughout the entire hotel without exception! + Value for money (especially if you have the upgrade as an SLH member). + The welcome "champagne" + The atmosphere, and very risky but successful decoration/theme exercise. Bad points (Hard to find but only minors). - The Bed is a bit on the "soft side". - Not enough shelves on the "integrated" wardrobes. - I could not find the Nespresso capsules. - The largest room can only accommodate up to 3 people (Sofa bed for the third). Well overall a reference for a great hotel in Paris, but hey for such a gem......"please don't tell".

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time”
Reviews.Author: BroganT-P
Reviews.Content: Boutique is absolutely the word to use. Fabulously, well presented and exceptionally clean Boutique Hotel. We have just returned from our weekend and very much enjoyed our stay. The staff are incredibly friendly and extremely helpful. It was snowing on the day of our checkout and we were not flying until 8.30pm. We asked if we could leave our bags and use the hotel facilities in the afternoon upon our return - and even though we had checked out, their words were - "we are here to look after you, this is your home" Tremendous service :o) The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from Port Maillot RER & Metro Stations & also from the bus that goes to Charles De Gaulle Airport, so very accessible to the main attractions/airport. We would highly recommend this hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: HannesGraz
Reviews.Content: Nice place with a good connection for business and sight seeing. Very friendly staff and good breakfast. All in all a good hotel with a good price performance ratio for Paris. Clean and well equipped gym and sauna. Only thing I missed is a relaxation room after the sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Defiantly Returning”
Reviews.Author: LynzNLee
Reviews.Content: I cannot express enough how much of a pleasure this hotel was to stay in. We had gotten engaged a few days earlier and our trip to Paris was to celebrate. The most romantic city in the world lived up to its reputation as everywhere you looked there was a beautiful sight to behold. The hotel only added to this experience as I can safely say the decor in this boutique hotel is exquisite! To top it off we couldn't have wished for nicer staff, every member of the team was friendly and genuinely interested in helping you have the best possible experience during your stay in Paris. I would like to say a huge thank you to you all as you made us feel really well looked after and this added to how special our break turned out to be. You are a credit to the hotel. To finish I will jus say we will definitely be returning. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small boutique hotel if you go to Paris”
Reviews.Author: mkdon5
Reviews.Content: Hotel was as described. We had a suite which was small but beautifully furnished with lots of high tech. Only downside was no view from our room. Honesty bar is a great idea. Did not eat here but nice bars and restaurants nearby. A little way out of town but metro station nearby. We liked walking so were happy to get to the big sights on foot (Arc de Triomphe about 15 mins). Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, stylish, true Paris experiance”
Reviews.Author: Agnieszka F
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at this charming boutique hotel between christmas and new years. It was fantasticly charming, the room was super stylish, cozy and comfortable. The bathtub was tres amazing and big enought to fit the two of us with room to spare. It's full of little details that made our stay extra special ! Little chocolates and pillow spray, lux coffe maker and lux tea all free and more. The toiletries were tip top as well and made bath time fantastic. There was also a tv in the bathroom which made it fun. The staff was top class, very helpful and willing to do anything to make us happy, there were great at recommending places to eat and visit around the area. Location is perfect, on quiite street but close enought to all the things that Paris had to offer. We did not want to leave it was hard. I can't wait to come back !! Thank you to all the staff for making our stay most amazing and stylish and cozy !

Reviews.Title: “Different in the best possible way”
Reviews.Author: PaulofAylesbury
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel! From the moment you enter this wonderful boutique hotel you know you are in a special hotel. The decor is very bright and modern in the public areas and there was always enough seating. The 'honesty bar' was refreshing and much appreciated. My bedroom and bathroom were excellent and quite large for Paris (mine even had a small balcony with a seat and table). The hotel is a pleasant 10 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. Nearest metro is Porte Maillot. I didnt take the breakfast as it seemed a bit pricey but there are plenty of cafe bars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILovemyWestie
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Paris and Les Jardins and her staff are lovely. The first thing I noticed about our room was how great it smelled - the towels, the toiletries, the little pillow spary. Our room was small but very stylish - very clean and tidy - everything had its place. The bed was so comfortable and the room quiet. Both mornings breakfast was delicious and the two different servers were very kind and helpful. Its in a great area, away from all the noise and traffic but has many restaurants and little shops. Its very close to the Metro as well. We would stay here again should we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel, a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Raj R
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here - rooms are very stylish (though small, as other reviewers have mentioned), and the staff very friendly. It was our first trip to Paris though, and although the hotel is convenient to the Metro, we found ourselves wishing we had stayed somewhere more central - lots of back and forth trips to the center of town to see the Louvre, Notre Dame, St. Germain, etc. One quibble - our room was very stuffy, and we couldn't control the thermostat. We had to open the windows at night to get some fresh air (how nice to be able to do this) and then get up to close them when it got cold (Paris in December).

Reviews.Title: “Neat rooms - with the extra benefit of cigarette smoke, and a rip off breakfast”
Reviews.Author: dubainick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last May on back of good reviews. First the good/neutral things: 1) room is stylish and although not large by Paris standards reasonable; 2) location is convenient - plenty of restaurants. There are more salubrious parts of Paris but good for transport; 3) OK value for money. Downsides: 1) courtyard room gives the ability to open the window onto a nice quiet pleasant spot - until the smokers (who are now expelled to the outside and seem to dominate outside tables etc etc in Paris more than any other city), gather on the ground floor and the delights of cigarette smoke and conversation permeate the room, so window shut. 2) breakfast appalling value for money - Euro 29 for a moderate and a very limited cooked breakfast. I had thought it was included and my fault for not checking properly but when you get a good 5 star hotel full buffet breakfast or al la carte in London for similar price, I was flabbergasted . One day we had appalling service from the staff member responsible for standard things not available.. We were basically told to get stuffed by the staff member. Took this up to management who did acknowledge the poor service, but for the quality of breakfast and lack of choice etc, a fair price would be around Euro12. The positive was finding out how expensive it was, so we went to the boulangerie for breakfast afterwards. Overall recommendation - if you smoke and have breakfast outside the hotel - great. Otherwise keep searching one of the toughest cities in the world to find a really decent good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “stylish, but a little claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: dave_reeder
Reviews.Content: my usual paris hotel being booked, i decided to try this one - which, in fact, is opposite the street - and was pleased i did. relentlessly stylish it may be, but the welcome is warm, the facilities excellent and the location perfect. rooms are small and the decoration a little overwhelming for the size, but the beds are comfortable and the bathroom well appointed. best feature of the hotel is probably the interior courtyard which has been turned into a comfortable open-air lounge, with well equipped honesty bar, a small library and an internet point. if they provided snacks, i suspect many visitors wouldn't leave! a bit pricey for it to be a regular hotel for me, but i really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClareMad
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a deluxe room for one night when in Paris for the Christmas markets. Room not particularly big (but I gather rooms in Paris are renowned for being small) but very nice. The bed was AMAZINGLY comfortable, possible the best I've ever slept in. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but used the honesty bar in the evening which was great to use as a night cap and cheaper than the cloest pub (the Irish one - do not go there!!). Location for us was fine, the metro was a couple of minutes walk away and they are so frequent, well connected and cheap it's easy to get around in Paris. Above all else the staff were exceptional. I would definitely stay here again and happy to recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: John091
Reviews.Content: This was really good. Stayed there for the second part of our honeymoon, and would go back. It had a really independent feel, I liked the honesty bar (hope it works for them) and the shower was great. The room had a high end feel to it. My missus particularly liked the nespresso machine in the room and the range of (free) films on the TV. The surrounding area is non-touristy - we went to several of the local bistros, found ourselves to be the only non-french patrons and had some really good food.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Junior suite Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Alex M
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three night stay in the hotel Jardins De La Villa and couldn't recommend it more. The Junior suite is slightly small but equipped with everything you need from an AMAZING bathroom with an extra large bath for two and great separate shower. The interactive television in the room has a selection of free films and music to keep you busy when you're not rushed off your feet, free coffee maker - just pretty much all you would need. The staff were friendly and helpful. All in all a worthwhile stay and i wouldn't bother writing a review if I didn't genuinely feel this way. Only negative I have to mention is the fact that the breakfast was 27 euro's per person but just next door are a selection of patisseries to choose from which are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: reto_k1
Reviews.Content: On a business trip to Paris, combined with a week-end to ourselves, we booked a hotel near the palais de congrès. Not only did this choice prove to be very convenient (the hotel is only two minutes from the palais' main entrance) but also a very good value. Though the rooms might be a little on the small side, they are very comfortably furnished and there is a nice boutique-y touch to the Jardins des Villa. But what made us choose "Excellent" over "Very Good" for the overall rating was the quality of the service. This is the first time in a hotel of this price range that the welcoming words of "do not hesitate to call us if you need anything" really meant just that. Great!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel next to Palais de Congres”
Reviews.Author: auspoot
Reviews.Content: We did not have too much difficulty finding our hotel via the metro from the airport. The hotel is located on a small street just around the corner from the Palais de Congress near Neuilly Porte Maillot. The staff were very helpful and our junior suite room was beautiful. Very spacious (and luxurious) for Paris. There was free wifi internet (although the speed was very slow at times) in our room, or 2 computers available on the ground floor. Breakfast was not included in our room rate and we did not have breakfast at the hotel. In all, a beautiful hotel we would not hesitate to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: adubai33
Reviews.Content: Spend 3 nights at the hotel for a business trip, very nice location, staff very helpful, decoration and design of the hotel beautiful, breakfast was delicious. The room was quiet, very well decorated, and service excellent. I would definitely recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “small and intimate hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vivich
Reviews.Content: The hotel can be a bit far from tourist location but it is not far from the subway! As for me, I stayed in this hotel for a congress that took place at le palais des congrès which is 2min walk from the hotel. The suite is a little bit small compared to other big hotel but well-decorated and comfortable with a great bathroom. There is a small fitness center with 4 or 5 modern machins and a hammam and sauna also. The parisien breakfast really worth it: it's cheap and you eat very well, the bread is excellent and the marmelade as well. The only negative point was the service room, for a lack of rigor (for exemple, they forgot to clean the cup of coffee or forgot to put other coffee capsule etc...) So to conclude, I highly recommand this hotel which has a great family atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: Viliv
Reviews.Content: Room has been boooked by email, always got an answer back. Nice welcome, could leave my luggage at the hotel, good breakfast. Just need to tell a bit more about the room service, that wasn't as good as I was expected for a 4 stars hotel...cups of coffee wasn't washed, expresso capsules and bottle of water were omitted, have to repeat three times for the sofa bed to be closed. When you stay in that kind of hotel you're not supposed to care of all about that, and not supposed to have the impression to disturb when you ask for something as well...unfortunately, that was the impression I had about the room service. The reception and persons for breakfast service were very helpful. So beautiful room, quiet, delicious breakfast, had a nice stay anyway, but Was just wondering what I was paying for sometimes... Hope it's an isolated case...

Reviews.Title: “Extended weekend exploring Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Anne M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 4 nights in Les Jardins de la Villa in mid-November. I was delighted from the second we got in the front entrance with how amazing the hotel was! It can be rare that the pictures on the website actually match how the building appears in person! The service was excellent, right from the check in, until the check out! We were amazed with how well furnished the bedroom was, it truly gave the appearance of a boutique hotel. The location was great, being a 2 minute walk to the nearest Metro stop, and only 2 stops away from the Champs-Elysees/Arc de Triomphe. We never felt intruded on by the staff, and it was the little details, such as the chocolates on the bed when we arrived back to our room late in the evenings, that rounded off the stay incredibly well! :) I would definitely go back to this great hotel on a trip back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in paris”
Reviews.Author: youssouf t
Reviews.Content: I spent in Les Jardins de la Villa one night in mid november. From the greating to the end of the stay, the service was excellent. The suite in which my wife and I stayed, was really calm and well furnished. We felt like home as soon as we entered that place and it's the main feeling that remains from our stay. If you are looking for a luxury boutique hotel close to the main touristic place, don't search more, you found it. The concept of the honesty bar is just original and smart. We loved it and we can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel.. Great Staff.. Cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: pamela s
Reviews.Content: Went there with my two lovely daughters and my four year old grandson Alfie for a long weekend. We had a fantastic stay. The staff were amazing and very friendly, they made us feel very welcome from the minute we got there. The deco was amazing and very hip! All very laid back in the nicest way, loved the honesty bar and mini kitchen.. Loved the gym and sauna a great touch and the sauna a must after a long day sightseeing! I will tell all my friends and will return again soon..

Reviews.Title: “Nice in English”
Reviews.Author: petrus47
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 nights in October.I spoke french( grew up in Paris) upon arrival and for the first 2 days.The service was just awful.I then showed up for breakfast on the 3rd morning and spoke english only. It was as if it were in another hotel.The rooms are much too small and the decor is somewhat over the top.I will find another hotel for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! I would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: TalGeoff
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. The rooms are small but beautifully decorated and the space very cleverly maximized. We did not feel cramped which has been my experience in other European hotels. The extra touches were wonderful. The nespresso machine in our room ( brilliant!) and flat screen tv.The service was excellent and the staff friendly and so helpful. Breakfast was reasonable by Paris standard and yum. Great little honesty bar and free wi fi.It's located right near the airport shuttle bus ( a pleasure ) and the port maillot metro ( very central) made it really easy to get around. We loved it and would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thetathams
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just for one night and found the room lovely, fantastic bathroom and little balcony The staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a picky traveler...& I will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: NYArtistGirl
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel. The hotel was very clean (this is a sticking point for me...think OCD) & the beds were comfortable. In addition to the gourmet chocolates (ginger, lavender, lemon) they would leave little lavender aromatherapy sprays by the bed for the linens. Personally, a favorite scent. Our room had a small patio (no view) with two chairs which worked out perfectly as the weather was nice & we liked having a simple breakfast outside before venturing out. There was an espresso machine in the room & we'd bring in croissants to have with our coffees in the a.m. The staff we encountered were all very nice & helpful. I was unsure about the location as before I stayed on the Ile St. Louis which is a perfect location. There is a close metro stop & plenty of cabs are available just around the corner in front of the larger hotel. I enjoy walking in Paris, so I didn't mind the longer walks from the hotel to the area of the Louvre... The only thing I would change about this hotel is I would pick it up & move it to the Ile St. Louis... I will certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel - can't recommend enough!”
Reviews.Author: KirstyHeard
Reviews.Content: I was given a surprise trip to Paris for my birthday back in August (sorry it's taken so long to post this review!). It took us a little while to find it, but that was mainly due to our (my!) poor map reading skills...it also took us a little while to come to terms with the Metro lines and how to read those maps. Upon arriving, we were greeted by an incredibly friendly concierge who took the essential details and showed us to our room. It was a cosy room, but really nice - beautiful, minimalistic decor with a wonderful shower and incredibly comfortable bed (with turn-down service thrown in at no extra cost, as we discovered upon arriving back later that evening). All the staff we spoke to were incredibly helpful and respectful; can't rate them highly enough. The hotel was close to the metro, on the central line which takes you to all the main attractions (or most of them anyway). We didn't eat here, preferring to wander out and find little cafe's, so can't comment on the food - although the dining area looked lovely! The whole hotel was beautifully laid out with a very clean feel to it - lots of black and white, with pink accents (something I, in particular, appreciated!). Can't recommend this hotel enough. If/when we return to Paris, we shall definitely be staying here again. Thanks for a wonderful few days!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely.....”
Reviews.Author: KsChris
Reviews.Content: Loved this small but comfy hotel. Close proximity to many major sites- walked most everywhere from the hotel. Quiet neighborhood. Room was very small but very clean and nice. Staff was very helpful. Would stay here again upon a return trip! Overall great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect, but pretty 'darn' good”
Reviews.Author: gpb13
Reviews.Content: Ok folks - when they use the word boutique, here is the quintessential example. This place is TINY. But, for what little space they have, I would state you will be very pleased with the environment. The rooms are tight - do not show up with two (2) or three (3) large suitcases and think they will be tucked away - not happening. There are no work desks (fold-away, but certainly not practical) and there is not even any space for a iron/iron board (although it was made available upon request). They play here is in the details. The "honesty bar", the decor, the sunflower shower heads, the garden courtyard. Even the stairwell is quite nicely decorated. For a hotel short on space, the stiletto chair in the foyer makes no sense, no matter how couture. Our stay was relatively cheap (based on other comments) and some state its out of the way. To us, however, for the money its in a GREAT location. You either walk 10 minutes (direct shot) to the Arc / Champs Elysses or simply hop on the Metro at La Defense and you are in the midde of everything. The deskhelp all speak English and were relatively helpful. The wake-ups were done by people, not automated and all were on time. They called cabs when requested and even offered up a few "free" drinks when I was stuck in the elevator for 1/2 hour (which they stated was the first occurence ever - lucky me). Stay away from the breakfast - 27 Euros is steep and there are simply too many bakeshops around to warrant eating in. Most importantly - after long walks along the Seine and sightseeing some of the citys best, you want a restful nights sleep. We found the beds comfortable, but the best feature is the hotel is along a quiet sidestreet - it was absolutely peaceful. Get a beer down the street at the James Joyce irish pub then call its a night. This was our first stay in Paris, so I cannot compare to anything else, but overall we were pleased and while we will try someplace else shiould we return, I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “World Class boutique hotel... (however)”
Reviews.Author: Welcomkerry
Reviews.Content: Les Jardines is truly a world-class boutique hotel, and you pay thru the nose for it. My wife and I typically stay in 5-star hotels, but we'd never paid $600 per night for a room only slightly larger than a walk-in closet. Once you accept the miniature room size, however, you're in for a fantastic stay. The staff could not be more helpful, and their English was excellent. The morning breakfast was superb, and the location near the Arc d' Triomphe was surprisingly peaceful and quiet. We would happily stay there again, assuming we are traveling light. (when our two suitcases were on the floor you literally could not walk).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable,well located and clean "home from home"in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jasperparklodge
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel from the moment we arrived to a warm welcome from Stefan and Pierre Luc (concierge). During our stay we encountered other staff and all seemed helpful and friendly.The room on the first floor was quite small but more than adequate for our needs and very well presented. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was excellent (It is also a bath so suits all needs). My wife said the room was meticulously clean (she always checks thoroughly) and she also loved the little extras like pillow spray and chocolates.We were there 3 nights and on a couple of occasions had some noisy late night revellers passing outside but that was on the Saturday night so not unusual wherever you are and they were only brief incidents. Otherwise the rooms were quiet save for the odd bump from above on another night but no real disturbance. The lounge area was really comfortable with more than enough room and with the help yourself honesty bar it really felt like you could relax as and when you wished and treat it like your own home. If you wanted tea it was free.There is also a small (4 seats) outside garden. The location just a few minutes walk from a combined Metro and RER staion so getting around is easy and quick. There are also numerous inviting restaurants, bistros etc. within a few minutes walk in each direction. Across the road from the hotel is an Irish bar showing sports on a large screen. Its an easy stroll to the Arc de Triomphe and the view from up there was spectacular as it also was from Montmatre a few metro stops away (a steep climb from the Moulin Rouge but worth the effort). We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as we were out early sightseeing and there are many patisseries to choose from. We stayed with another couple who were also very pleased with the hotel room,location etc. Would we stay again? We're already planning it.

Reviews.Title: “Would visit again - recommend”
Reviews.Author: bonitabeachbabe
Reviews.Content: Nice room, great staff, trendy decor and close to ligne 1 which I need on trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Comfortable & Impeccable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin R
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised by the luxury level of our room. The bathroom was small but laid out with much forethought. The bed was very comfortable & the black out curtains were a nice touch. Very nice room service breakfast. Within walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe & the Trocadero.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for Paris”
Reviews.Author: SNTas
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has a bit of out there feel to it. Pink and silver decor! Noisy coffee machine, but great teas in the honesty bar area. The garden is so small don't expect to do anything in it. Very close to good restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “awesome paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clemmie_11
Reviews.Content: great hotel, quiet, very modern, wonderful staff. location is not tourist central but close to metro and RER, restaurants, bars, short walk to Arch of Triumph, Champs Elysees

Reviews.Title: “Small comfortable with great service”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireRunner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. No complaints at all. Staff very friendly and helpful. The gym is very basic but has good quality equipment. Treadmill has hardly been used. The dining faclities are very basic, almost non-existent. Breakfast is available but no restaurant. Not a problem though as there are a few good quality places within 5 minute walking distance. Free wifi a bonus - and it works too. The Nespresso machine in the room was really quite good and a bit different from other hotels. Very strange bar facilities!!!!! No staff, just an honesty bar where you pay for what you drink, but as the prices are the same as the room's mini-bar.....you would have to be very honest to use it. Handy for the Metro - Porte Maillot 5 minute walk

Reviews.Title: “Small funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkP4
Reviews.Content: Jardins de la villa is somewhat out of the way hiding near Porte Malliot but it has a number of things going for it. While it's a small hotel the rooms are a nice size and are equipped with a nespresso machine. There is also one in a lounge area that doubles as a breakfast area which is handy when you run out of capsules :-) Breakfast was a pleasant change with a large variety of items. Staff were pleasant and helpful. It's about a 15€ taxi ride from Gare du Nord and the Porte Malliot metro station is a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “A very trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohannaBananaBee
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights and our stay was very pleasant. We booked a suite so we had a large tiled bathtub with a mirrored TV. Our other bathroom featured heated towel racks and heated mirrors to prevent condensation, which was neat. Bed was comfy and the sheets could be a bit nicer, but it wasn't a big inconvenience. Service was helpful and friendly, and the location convenient since the metro and RER lines were only a block away. Also very close to some nice restaurants and the Palais des Congress which has some nice shops and an upscale grocery store.

Reviews.Title: “Not central enough, Very small rooms, lovely staff though”
Reviews.Author: kiwiguests
Reviews.Content: Probably our first 'dud'recommendation using tripadvisor reviews. I didn't do enough research on this property, if I had I would of realised it was not central enough for us. Although the rooms were beautifully furnished they are very very small and very NOISY, each night revellers cut through the side street from hotels and make alot of noise, and then the rubbish trucks, street sweepers do the same thing at some ungodly hour each morning. Oh well, I learnt to be even more picky when choosing a place to stay for us!

Reviews.Title: “breakfast in bed”
Reviews.Author: Thomas S
Reviews.Content: It seems everything has been said about this hotel. It's stylish, truly boutique, in a very good location and has exceptional staff. If one is a true believer in 'form follows function' then you may have 1 or 2 issues with some of the installations that are more about design than about being practical (see how long it takes you to figure out the water taps in the bathroom). All in all this is a fabulous little hotel with friendly, competent and accessible staff. The finishing of the rooms is quite extraordinary and even though they are not big everything is there. I enjoyed the little gimmicks like daily weather forecast and pillow spray. The staff are super friendly and service oriented. As an example, when we needed a nanny the hotel organized a fabulous young lady for our 3-year old daughter. Probably the best part is to have the breakfast delivered to your bedroom. Make your selection and choose the time and hang the form onto your door. The following morning you will spoil yourself to a fantastic breakfast in bed.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and very quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: NikZuri
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three days and liked it very much. It was VERY clean and they pay lot of attention to details. Every floor has not more than 4 or 5 rooms, which is nice, so there's not always 10,000 people on the hallways. That brings me to the next point: it was really, really quiet. I think it's because it lies in a very short sidestreet. Our room was very small, but it did not bother once, because of its clever design and Layout. Nice touch: every room has a own Nespresso machine with free coffee/tea. The bathroom is very nice. Modern, very clean and with lots of cleverly placed mirrors (so that it seemed much bigger than it actually was). Even when this little gem of a hotel is not in the heart of paris, at least it is very near to the metro line 1, which is one of the most important lines to get everywhere quick. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: gracediba
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful, clean rooms, friendly helpful staff- overall a wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Paris Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: KMarieR
Reviews.Content: I just got back from five nights in Paris and had the time of my life. Les Jardins de la Villa was responsible in large part for my enjoyment. As most of these reviews note, it's a true boutique hotel--five floors with, as I recall, four rooms per floor. So the feel is intimate and cozy. I stayed in a suite on the top floor. It was not a suite in the classic sense of the word--there was only one main room and I didn't have a couch or any other true living room furniture. But it was perfect for my needs, comfortable and beautifully decorated. Even the bathroom was a treat with a rain forest showerhead and a tub that was literally big enough for me to float in (and I'm 5'5"). Everything is of excellent quality, with all the little touches that make a difference--a Nespresso machine in the room, chocolates every night and lavender scented spray for the pillows. The staff is so welcoming and kind, and really go out of their way to see to your needs. The location is terrific. I've seen some concern voiced that the hotel is off the beaten path. It may not be located on the Champs Elysees. But it's only a ten minute walk to the Arch de Triomphe and the metro is half a block away. You can be at the Louvre in 15 minutes. There are also several excellent bistros within a few minutes walk, and a fairly large mall under the Palais des Congres where you can find a Paul's, a market and other services. I loved the neighborhood. It was quiet enough that I slept with my windows open every night and had no trouble falling to sleep. This is an absolutely wonderful haven after a busy day of shopping and sightseeing. When I return to Paris, I know Les Jardins de la Villa will be my first choice when it comes to choosing a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “On a 5 out of 5 scale i would have to give it a 6+”
Reviews.Author: JanetB2011
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we unfortunately had to leave, everything was perfect. The rooms were impeccably clean (and I'm very fussy), the service and staff were always there with a smile and eager to help with anything we needed. The breakfast was delicious and reasonable. The beds were extremely comfortable. I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. I had booked three rooms for 8 of us traveling together and we all felt this was a very special hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you like attention to detail and a little bit of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Walfie25
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel with wonderful attention to detail. It's small, but it only adds to its charm, and the rooms are equipped to the highest spec we've ever enjoyed at a hotel of this size. The beds are incredibly comfortable (slept better than we had in ages) and the spa, the coffee maker, the slippers and robe all help to make this a very relaxing stay. Our bathroom was a wetroom (hence why some people's reviews report that the showers make a mess - think that's the point of a wetroom, no?) Staff were very helpful, overall decoration excellent and selection of tea/coffee/refreshments in mini-bar all helped to make you feel like you were being spoilt with little upmarket luxuries at every step. Our only criticism is that the rooms are a little on the small side but to be honest, they're so well put together it doesn't become an imposing problem. Arc du Triomphe is about a 10/12 minute walk so not in a bad location. Taxi rank round the corner. The owners clearly know what they're doing with this hotel - fantastic stay and wonderful little touches which make it impossible not to want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Amongst the best Paris has to offer.”
Reviews.Author: chrisodonnell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got were married on 20 August 2011 and I had booked a surprise "mini-moon" for a few nights at Les Jardins de la Villa. The hotel was ideally situated, close to a number of excellent restaurants and the Porte Maillot metro station which provides an extremely convenient route across the centre of Paris. Paris has always been very special to us and we have stayed in a variety of hotels over the years ranging from the Best Western Astra Opera to the Park Hyatt. As you would expect the Hyatt set an extremely high benchmark. I can honestly say that Les Jardins de la Villa exceeded the standard previously set by the Hyatt. Les Jardins de la Villa is rather unique in its ability to remain both elegant and beautiful whilst retaining a truly classy quirkiness. The entire hotel is outfitted in a boutique style with individual furniture and artwork. I would stress, however, that whilst this hotel feels truly unique, the decoration does not in any way feel forced or gimmicky. Each room feels like a creation and it was a joy experience. I had booked a deluxe room but on arrival we were informed that we had been upgraded to one of the junior suites. The room was beautiful, the perfect blend of classic quality furniture with fashionable decoration and a pleasantly surprising plethora of technology. Both the bedroom and bathroom were immaculate and extremely spacious, I simply cannot find enough superlatives to describe it. In the room was a large (32"?) flat screen TV which was connect to the hotel's own TV, movie and music service. The TV provided free access to a large database of very recent movie spanning a wide range of genres for on-demand viewing and whilst, no-one should travel to Paris to stay in their hotel room, the level of entertainment offered here is to my mind unrivalled. All of the above considered, our stay was made truly special by the staff. I had spoken briefly with Pierre-Luc, the concierge, prior to arriving who was extremely helpful and very patient with my very rusty french. Whilst I cannot remember the names of all of the staff who made our stay special, they were all extremely friendly and could not have done more to make us feel welcome. In particular I would like to say a huge thank you to Stéphame who always extremely helpful and friendly but also incredibly patient and courteous, always allowing me to speak in french no matter how much I struggled. Nothing ever felt like too much trouble, thank you. Les Jardins de la Villa made this trip to Paris extra special and we will certainly return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jmichielen
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel for a one night trip to Paris. The hotel is located in a nice area near the Champs-Élysées and although the rooms are not big they feel very spacious, are perfectly clean (almost feels brand new), well designed and no street noise enters the room. The restaurant we were planning to go to was fully booked but the friendly hotel staff suggested a few very good restaurants in the area, at the same time they booked us tickets to the Crazy Horse so they helped us very much in making the one night in Paris to become a great night. The next morning we had breakfast in our room which finally wasn't such a continental breakfast but a decent breakfast, Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Chic”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl061
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent three weeks in Europe with seven days at Les Jardins de la Villa. As you can see from the pictures, this is a very chic boutique hotel. I LOVED the decor! The staff were very helpful with directions, etc. Located right around the corner from the metro, close to the Arc de Triumphe and the Avenue Des Champs Elysees we felt close to the wonders of Paris, but far enough to decompress in the garden or their lounge area. The staff assisted me with many travel arrangements (Versailles and Monet's home-which are a both outside the city, but worth the trip!) Make sure to go to the patisserie on the corner-SCRUMPTIOUS! If intimate and chic are your requirements you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic boutique hotel with yummie breakfast”
Reviews.Author: dittimitti
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Only 3 metro stops from the very heart of the city. Surrounded with nice restaurants and coffees. ROOM: small, but stylish. Ideal for weekend romance. :) ATMOSPHERE: trendy but in the same time cosy. BREAKFAST: limited assortment, but very fresh, high quality and delicious! Best I have had in the last year... SERVICE: nothing special, but they don't tolerate late check-out.

Reviews.Title: “large modern decor room with tiny niggles”
Reviews.Author: Stanley2008
Reviews.Content: this hotel is located in zone 2 of paris and not zone 1 (ie central). however it is just 2 metro stops away from arc de triumph or about a 6euro taxi ride. the louvre is about 6 stops away. effiel tower about 5 aside from the negative bias towards the location the hotel is very good. the room was big, bright and furnished to a very high standard. modern decor. everything like new. lovely tv, wardrobe, bathroom (although no bath tub but the biggest shower ive seen can fit 4-5 people!), coffee machine, lovely carpet. however like the other reviewers the shower can have a tendency to overflow and partially flood the bathroom staff were friendly, helpful and presentable however my partner left some loose change on the table during the middle of our stay and we found it was gone! maid mistaken it for a tip we guess. also it appeared bottle of water was only offered on day 1. we never recieved any more bottles after day 1. also soap bars intermittently replaced. i advise you not to leave euros on the table! also my partner noticed the maid did not top up the coffee machine with water and inconsistency with the tea selection. one day we would get english breakfast but never again (weird). my partner also noticed hole in sheets but next day gone. so they did change the sheets! breakfast was not included and expensive. think it was 17euros. across the road there is a shopping centre and one floor down there is a paul and supermarket. the lunch dinner menu at hotel wasnt also much cop. however along the main road (boulevards des marechaux) from the nearest metro station (porte maillot) to hotel there a number of good reasonable priced restaurants i wanted to give a 5 but in the end we decided a 4. definitely recommended if you do not mind taking the metro/inconsistency with maid service. a strong 4 or 4+

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: FTJS
Reviews.Content: We could not fault this hotel - beautiful room with extremely comfortable bed, great shower, fantastic breakfast, friendly staff. Hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, convenient and very comfortable - a winner!”
Reviews.Author: Canbasher
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. We had 2 rooms: hubby and I, our boys 17 & 22. We found it luxurious - everyone slept great! It was quiet, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was delicious with lots of choices. The staff was friendly and helpful. The wifi works great. There are lots of restaurants close by (some pricey) but we found a great raclette place down the street on Avenue des Ternes called Le Brasier that was reasonable priced and delicious. There is also a small convenience store 2 doors down and a produce store close by should you want to pick up fruits or snacks. It close to both the Metro and RER. The stream room and sauna are nice to have after a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and fantastic friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: shanghaishaniqua
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay here after reading a bunch of positive reviews on Tripadvisor. Everything that people said about this place is correct. We got a junior suite which was quite spacious and we were particularly impressed with in-room amenities including a deluxe nespresso machine and an entertainment system that offered on demand music and movies (for free!). The location is decent (the walk to Champs Elysees was about 15-20 min but we didn't mind the walk). And most notably the service staff were fantastic! Our requests were always quickly met and always with a great attitude. Pierre Luke even arranged a dinner reservation for us at a lovely restaurant about 5 minutes walk from the hotel (Chez Georges) where we had one of the best meals on our trip! Only one glitch was the drain in our shower wasn't working so we ended up flooding the bathroom a couple of times. Other than that, the stay was memorable and we will definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Very special”
Reviews.Author: CruelFox
Reviews.Content: We started our honeymoon at this hotel and we were not disappointed. The staff upon arrival were so friendly and informative. Our room was small but well equipped with Nespresso machine and all other mod cons. The bed was very comfortable and we had the nicest romantic terrace. The hotel is well located for accessing all areas of Paris (the metro is 2 minutes walk), and the surrounding areas are beautiful and full of nice restaurants and bars. Highly recommended and we will stay here when we are in Paris next.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay...Don't Take a Car!”
Reviews.Author: FoodJunkie66
Reviews.Content: Overall Comments: Mixed feelings…a bit try hard, without the real facilities. Very small hotel with some limitations. Room: Very small but well though out with modern furnishings. Tiny bathroom, but again well thought out. Free movies and wifi are a plus. Location: Just okay…on the North West side of the city ten minutes walk to Arc de Triumph, but most of the main tourist attractions quite a distance. Good restaurants and bars nearby. Good access to Metro. Facilities: None to speak of. Gym is basic with a treadmill, step machine and that is about it. No restaurant, just basic breakfast. Food: None Service: Friendly but pretty hopeless. Parking: No parking is available, despite the advertising. You cannot even pull up outside the hotel without a queue of cars forming and beeping their horns. This hotel is not a place to take a car. There is a public underground car park nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel!"”
Reviews.Author: its_tuc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights in July 2011. Rooms are a good size, vere clean, and beautifully decorated. The washroom is also very modern and big. The hotel itself has a trendy-quirky feel to it. The lobby area is very nice and the outside communal patio is small but a perfect place to relax and read. The location is very close to the Arc the Triomph and Eiffel Tower. The experience was excellent and I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful design hotel with attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: beguinner1976
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a nice surprise. It is really new and the staff is really attentive and helpful. We arrived early and we are given all the attention and could have shower before our room was ready. The decoration is beautiful and functional. The carpet in the room is clean, the bed was huge and pillows confy, the bathroom had a bathtube and was big. The room was not that big, but I think it was not to small for Paris standards. The flat screen TV had free movies and we had a Nespresso machine at the room, with free nespresso and tea. Every night they would compliment us with something nice, such as chocolate and a nice message... In short, you get the luxury of a five stars in a location not far from main attractions and near a line 1 tube station. Beware that it is not so close of the Louvre, if you want to walk. By tube, it is very near.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been great, but missed the mark”
Reviews.Author: Sa4B3n
Reviews.Content: We arrived to be told that our original room was not available as they had double booked our room and for the first night of our honeymoon we had to be downgraded. As compensation they upgraded us for the remainder of the stay and gave us one day free breakfast. This is UNACCEPTABLE for a professionally run hotel, however they did make every effort to compensate for their mistake. If you are going to stay here we would recommend not staying in the superior room as it is really small. We stayed in rooms 34 (1 night), 55 (for about 2 hours) and 40 for 3 nights. Room 34: Was clean, has good style and the bed was comfortable, has a really cute balcony, lots of light and good ventilation. However the room was really really cramped and we struggled to fit our suitcases and ourselves in there. Room 55: We had been told the room would be ready for us in the morning, however when we discussed moving our luggage with them in the morning they informed us that it couldn't be done until 430pm that afternoon. Same cleanliness level as 34, however the TV volume did not work and the TV in the bathroom was also out of order. When my wife had a shower and half way through realised that the whole bathroom was flooded. The front desk staff quickly amended the situation and transferred us to room 40. Room 40: Again, the room was in good order, clean, good style etc. This is one of their junior suite rooms and is of a decent size (not huge, decent). There was still a leakage problem with the shower however it was minor compared to room 55. The bed was comfortable, the room was quiet, we liked the little touches like chocolates, umbrella's, Bose mp3 player etc. The air-conditioning worked really well and again it had plenty of light and ventilation. In general the front desk service was great, always helpful, especially Michael, who really bent over backwards to make sure our stay was memorable. This is why I struggle, it could have been a great stay, but little things like the first night and the leaking shower in 2 rooms let this hotel down immensely. My last little gripe is with the concierge who greeted us on the first day. He was very friendly until it came to tip time, as we had just gotten off the plane and had no change (nor was I going to tip 20 Euros) I couldn't tip more than the 1.50 or so Euro I had in my wallet. He was obviously displeased with this and acted so for the rest of our stay. He also seemed keen to see if my wife was Indian and kept hinting at it which drove her crazy as she is not. Les Jardins de la Villa missed the mark for us and for our next stay in Paris we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Small Luxury Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JohZac
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 7days (Deluxe Double Room). Apart from Metro, we strongly recommend taking buses to the following attractions from this hotel as the bus stop pretty close e.g. Tour Eiffel (bus 82), Arc de Triomphe/Champ Elysees (bus 73), Printemps (bus 43) etc. If you are traveling from CDG, the Les car Air France stop is just round the corner ~5mins walk i.e. opposite to the Le Meridien hotel. If you are traveling from Gare du Nord/Eurostar, you may take bus 43 to avoid carrying your heavy luggages up and down the stairscase if you choose to take RER/metro. There is a big supermarket in Palais des Congres (5 mins walk from hotel). Paul - the bakery - is right next to it where you could have breakfast. The hotel is located in a quiet street so you could get a good night sleep. All the staff can speak very good english and very friendly. Overall it is a very nice hotel and will definitely come back on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a reasonable cost”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_Heather
