Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for four nights at the end of July. We got a half price deal through Hotels.com, which made the price very good given the ratings the hotel had. We had a standard double room on the first floor of the hotel, which also had a balcony. The hotel is every bit as good as previous reviews had suggested. The small botique hotel has been recently renovated, and everything is very clean and to the highest standard. Rooms are relatively neat, and the bathroom is partitioned by a sliding door. This was the only downside to the room - not much soundproofing between the bathoom and the bedroom. We had drinks one evening in the hotel's honesty bar. A wide choice of drinks were available, and although a bit pricey, the sitting/lounge area was very relaxing. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but ate each morning at small patesserie 20 yards to the right of the hotel. For 9 euros they do a great breakfast of croisants and toasted bread for one third of the price charged by the hotel - great if you are on a budget. Some reviews have stated that the hotel is a bit out of the way, which we didn't agree with. The Arc de Triomphe was a 15 minute walk away and the Ternes metro stop was about 10 minutes from the hotel. There are also a number of great restaurants for breakfast, lunch and dinner on Avenue Ternes, within a 2 minute walk of the hotel. Overall, this is a great botique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vera976
Reviews.Content: Les Jardins de la Villa is a great hotel, on the great spot. It is 3 minutes away from the Arc de Triomphe and we walked the whole Paris from there. The rooms are small but very clean and cosy. After a long day walking the Paris it was a great place to go and rest. The bed was very comfortable and I am very picky when it comes to cleanness of the rooms and I have to say I felt like I was in my own apartment when it comes to that. The service at the hotel was good and the staff was very nice. Overall we would go back if we were in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it”
Reviews.Author: vindys
Reviews.Content: Last minute booking but wonderful. Nice part of Paris with nearby metro and taxis. Shopping centre with groceries in metro station so easy to get anywhere and get anything forgotten.Local bistros and patisseries are good but Paris is not cheap!. Hotel arrival was warm and helpful and most of the staff were multilingual.Room was absolutely gorgeous and very chic with lots of goodies supplied including an espresso machine.Beds comfy. Bathroom spotless with thick white fluffy towels. Breakfast is an extra but worth the money. In fact almost everything supplied can be bought in the hotel.Will stay here again and recommend it for couples/singles. Maybe not enough to do for children.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, classy, friend people”
Reviews.Author: Starison
Reviews.Content: Designed in a way that seemed very classy Parisiene to us simple folks from Idaho. Very modern and clean. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The location was just a little tricky to find the first time, but was convenient for all our activities.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, Ideally Located Hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Ami211
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were visiting Paris for the first time. We stayed at this hotel for 8 days and couldn't have been happier with our choice. The hotel is cute, CLEAN, and the people who work there are so kind. We were able to take the Air France Shuttle from CDG and it dropped us off at the Le Meridian, which is just around the corner from this hotel. We stayed in the deluxe room, which was the perfect size for the two of us. The hotel is located right next to a subway station, so we used the subway the whole time! I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: BoDC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right across the street from the Mall which is tied to the Metro :) They have a supermarket, bread shop, etc. I recommend getting breakfast at the bread shop. The hotel breakfast is great, but it's also 23 Euro per person, so it's a little expensive. You do get a whole bowl of bread, so it's worth it one time. You can take the bread and have lunch with it too :) You have tons of places to eat around the Hotel. I tried about 3 of them, all very good and less than all the tourist spots, so go explore. The gym is amazing, with a place to take a shower. My 8 year old daughter loved the turn down service and the chocolate they left, not to mention how the spray the pillow with a light fragrances. The only thing I didn't like about the hotel was the wi-fi. You get free Wi-Fi, but you can only have one device per room :( Other than that, I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and courtesy. Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: DavidFederica
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks exquisite. Very Designer decorated and cleaned. Its location is ideal and the service was impeccable. The Manager, Carol, is the most friendly and professional person we have ever met in a Hotel in Paris. She truly care for her guests and operates the hotel marvelously. The room was large enough and the bathroom not too spacious but very comfortable. The shower was the best part, very big! The whole environment smells good and offers a fantastic "honesty bar" where you can make your tea, coffee and drinks at any hour (we loved that). We didn't have breakfast at the hotel because we wanted to explore the pastry shops, however it looked pretty good and served in a relaxed environment with comfortable sofas. It was a wonderful experience. We have been in Paris at least thirty times (for business and pleasure) before and we will definitely go back to stay at the Jardins de la Villa during our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crystalhpi
Reviews.Content: Stephane and his team work very hard to make your stay quite enjoyable. The Junior Suite is very nice, and the bed is extremely comfortable. Lounge area which opens to the Garden is fantastic with a terrific breakfast of cheeses, breads, pastries, wonderful tea and coffee. We enjoyed staying in the lounge that we almost forgot that we had Paris to fall in love with. While it is three stops on the #1 Metro line beyond Arc de Triumph, it is a 4+ star boutique hotel that is worth every Euro...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel! Plus in room coffee machine!”
Reviews.Author: Rrrache
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for one week and from the moment we walked in to reception to the end of our stay we were surprised by the little details the hotel had, from the colours, wall art, in room coffee machine, service exceptional and very friendly staff, the honesty bar was a fantastic idea self serve bar any time of day you bill yourself! Room was not a small as expected from some of the reviews we read we found it very spacious and everything about the hotel we loved. Its less than five mins to the metro and close to some good bars, a shopping mall is around the corner too. It was a thirty or so min walk from Eiffel tower but a train ride of less than ten mins to all sites Paris! We would not hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Super Top Class Hotel with excellent amenities”
Reviews.Author: PhilSandersKent_UK
Reviews.Content: This is one of the friendliest and highest quality hotels that we have stayed in. Its staff are a delight, the ambience is superb and the location is excelllent being only a few minutes from teh Champs Elysees. It is also close to Metro Line number 1 which gives links to most of the major attractions. The hotel is chic and beautifully appointed. I cannot recommende it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the services at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kimnguyen0809
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel because everybody were very good with customers.Specially,Stephane the front desk manager. He very kind,friendly and helpful.We will be back! I will talk with my family and all my friends about hotel Les Jardins de la Villa in Paris and the good services in this hotel. My daughter liked the ways decoration of this hotel.The location of the hotel was very connivence for taking the metro,just take about ten or fifteen minutes with walking you can find the sign of the metro easily.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small luxury hotel.”
Reviews.Author: fiduroe
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor and are very pleased we did! The hotel is small and the superior room we had was not huge but we had enough room for our three night stay. The room was very clean, with good quality bedlinen and confortable bed. The bathroom had the biggest shower we've ever seen! Nice touches made our stay extra special, like the bed being turned down each evening, with pillow sprays and chocolates. No outside noise made for a good night's sleep. We did not eat at the hotel, but we did take advantage of the honesty bar and good Nespresso coffee. There are plenty of places nearby to get a pastry and coffee if you don't want to take breakfast at the hotel, as that is rather pricey in our opinion. The location is great for the Palais de Congress, and the Arc de Triomphe is a 10 minute walk away. Tour Eiffel, approx 30 minute walk. Special mention must go to the hotel staff, to Stephane (Front of House Manager) to the Concierge and the housekeepers. They were all very friendly and helpful. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jokey333
Reviews.Content: we have just got back from a 3 night stay at Les jardins de la Villa and it was fantastic. the staff were very friendly and helpful and would go out of their way to help you. We have stayed in lot on low, middle and top hotels and this was one of the best, the attention to detail was brilliant and the small courtyard with free coffee and honesty bar an extra. If we went back to paris we would not think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tasabout
Reviews.Content: Fabulous is the only word to describe this hotel. Our room was excellent with a lovely bathroom and very comfortable bed. Although the room was at the front of the hotel noise was not a problem. The staff are brilliant! Very helpful and knowledgeable as well as friendly and humorous. The hotel is well located being close to the Arc d' Triumph and the metro. Plenty of good restaurants are nearby that provide very good food at quite reasonable prices. Try 'Le Maison', the hotel staff will tell you where it is and will even book a table for you. This was my fourth stay in Paris and I can honestly say that this was the best hotel by far!! Would I stay again? Absolutely!!

Reviews.Title: “A Five Star Experience at a Four Star Price”
Reviews.Author: JohninWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: This is a neat hotel. Very new, very stylish, near the Arc de Triomphe, and a block and a half walk to the Porte Maillot Metro stop. It has every amenity you would want/desire in a five star hotel except a hotel restaurant and who needs a hotel restaurant in Paris? Reasonably priced for Paris, helpful staff, all English speaking. We'd happily stay here again. One tip: Rue Belidor is a one block long street unfamiliar to many Parisian cabbies and doesn't seem to appear on the Paris cab GPS system. Print out a Google map of the location to help your cabbie or ask the cab to take you to the Le Meriden Hotel opposite the Palais de Congres, go past the Meriden (it's a one way street so you'll be heading the right direction), take a right at the James Joyce Pub, and it's down the street on the right.

Reviews.Title: “A bit far from everything....”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMatt
Reviews.Content: This review is based on a 7-night stay during a month long European vacation which involved about 7 different hotels in quick succession, so I have a lot to compare to. The hotel, service, rooms, etc. were all good - the only thing I'd caution other travellers about is the location. It's within walking distance to Arc du Triumph and Champs-Elysees, but that's about it. If you're a first-time visitor to Paris hoping to hit up all the highlights, you're quite a few metro stops away from the Louvre, Orsay, Eiffel Tower, Crypts, Pompidou Center, Notre-Dame, etc. If I was advising a friend, I'd recommend that they save themselves a bit of time and hassle, and stay closer to the action, even if it means paying a little bit more or getting a little bit less for their dollar. One last thing - on the morning that we were leaving, the hotel called us a taxi which wasn't really a taxi (no running meter). Ended up paying 65 EUR for a ride to CDG airport... it would have at least been nice for the hotel to ask me whether I wanted a regular taxi, or a flat-fee service for which they probably get kickbacks for.

Reviews.Title: “A very quiet hotel near Porte Mailot”
Reviews.Author: deny67
Reviews.Content: I was on business trip working in La Defense so I wanted an Hotel not too far and on the Line 1. My wife was with me and we choose this hotel. Very nice, very quiet. Only thing to improve the bed sise (1.6m)

Reviews.Title: “Great French hotel”
Reviews.Author: conky123
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Les Jardins de la Villa and had a great time. Their attention to detail is amazing, including pillow spray (!?), chocolates to welcome us, use of the Nespresso machine in our room, lights in the wardrobe, the list goes on. It is very French and decorated to the max - I would describe it as luxuriously OTT (over the top), but it just works. The location is very handy as well, close to the Arc de Triomphe, as well as major train stations, and the huge park - Bois de Boulogne - is within an easy 10 minutes walking distance. Highly recommended. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: timjoslyn
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 1 night but what a great find this hotel is. The decor is wonderful, staff went out of their way to make us feel at home and the room (junior suite) whilst a little small was fantastic. We will be back...

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING / AMAZING / EXCEPTIONAL”
Reviews.Author: LouisBarazotti
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris on business for the 2 weeks prior. I had stayed in another hotel around the corner, but when I was sent back to Paris, that hotel was booked and not available.. I was unsure of what to expect when I arrived at the hotel, BUT... what an exceptional surprise. Even though the hotel was smaller, it's charm/character/staff made me feel like i was at home. I was shown to my room and was very very pleased with the decor, the amenities, but then.. I found the bathroom.. Being on business the thought of FREE Internet and Wireless was an added bonus. Unfortunately, due to business needs, I was forced to leave the hotel after one night, and will admit that I did not want to leave. When/IF I travel to Paris for personal reasons, I will make it a point to see if there is availability here and have told ALL my friends about the most pleasurable, but short, experience i had.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TerriandAlan
Reviews.Content: We were here for 8 days and I found this experience to be exceptional. My husband is blind and the staff could not have been any more helpful. The rooms are gorgeous and the bathrooms are luxurious considering last time I stayed in Paris I had to sit on the toilet to shave my legs! If you want luxury and the little things that make it special, stay here. Every night your bed is turned down and they leave pillow spray and chocolates, the weather report and a gorgeous reminder of what you need to do before you go to bed. Right from when we arrived from Australia, we were made to feel welcome by Stefan and Pierre Luc. I will recommend to everyone this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vloughry
Reviews.Content: went with another couple for vacation. we loved,loved,loved this boutique hotel. so beautiful and chic. bed was very comfortable, bathroom very big, room was beautiful. we had a balcony which overlooked the garden and also the window in the bathroom opened up to the garden. they have the best customer service, especially michael at the front desk, he helped us find our way around town and was so friendly. loved the complimentary coffee bar. it was close to pubs and restaurants. the metro station "porte maillot" was just down the street if your planning on using the subway. we will definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ljmmpotts1
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be small in size however the service and facilities are exceptional. The location to Port Maillot (the underground rail network) is less than two minutes walk. Nearby there are many high quality restaurants and bars. The rooms (Deluxe) are very expansive and extremly well appointed with all modern facilities and are kept spotlessly clean. The staff are very professional and helpful and willing to go out of their way to be of assistance. The continental breakfast was also very good value

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: behesht
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for more. It was a wonderful hotel and perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: exfg
Reviews.Content: My mother and I spend one night at Les Jardins de la Villa and it was so so wonderful. I wish we had been able to spend more time there! Everyone was so warm and super helpful and the room was gorgeous. Not too small with a beautiful enormous bathroom and great products. I will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, Spotlessly Clean, Fabulous Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Jade_Eliz79
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at Les Jardins Villa purely due to reviews on Trip Advisor. We weren't dissapointed. Service was fantastic, every person we came in contact with at the hotel did their upmost to ensure that we had a fabulous stay. Rooms are perfect, yes a little small if you compare to Australian and US room sizes but perfect for my husband and I...after all if you are in Paris why would you stay in your room! We had a lovely little balcony...perfect for an afternoon drink or a late night cuppa. Our room and bathroom were spotlessly cleaned every day. Toiletries are divine! Loved the little touches provided in the turn-down service (the beautiful lavendar pillow spray came in very handy on our flight back to Australia!) Our bed was soooo comfy and the rooms are really quiet. So quiet in fact that you forget you are in a hotel and in the middle of Paris! I looked forward to breakfast each and every day, the chocolate muesli is amazing! My husband doesn't drink tea or coffee and upon knowing this the breakfast waiter would prepare a hot chocolate for him each morning. Concierge were also wonderful - helping us to book restaurants. Our french isn't the best but we knew the restaurants we wanted to try so asked concierge to book them for us...nothing was a hassle for them at all. They were just fantastic. Thoroughly recommend Les Jardins to anyone travelling to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “J'adore le français”
Reviews.Author: JadeRat
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband finally went onto our honeymoon after being merried for half year. Our first destination was Pairs, France. Wehad a good time in Pairs and I Love the Hotel. The quality of serivce is equal to a 5 star hotel but you feel cozy and friendly being their guest. All the staffs speak proper English and they always have a smile on their face. It gave me a sense of "Damn, people over there really love what they do." Service: Staffs are friendly and professional. They make me feel very welcoming. Ambiance: Cute, classic, chic decoration. They have a small lounge right next to the lobby. It's a prefect area to have a glass of wine in the afternoon. The hotel is very clean and always smells good. Location: It's only 5 minutes walk from the Metro station, and feel safe in that neighbourhood. There are different kinds of resutaurant around the Hotel. Everything is within a walking distant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: hollyelizabeth23
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely perfect! My husband and I like to see a city on foot so we were happy with the position. We have stayed in a lot of 5* hotels and this was just as good as any. Spotlessly clean, wonderful staff, spacious (for Paris!) and just so gorgeous to look at! Well worth the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice we could have made!!”
Reviews.Author: jodianne2
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the reviews on trip advisor. We were not disappointed. The decor, the concierge and hotel staff, the room (with nespresso coffee machine) and the most comfy bed, the honesty bar, breakfast, computer with skype access... all superb. This hotel helped make our 10th anniversary and our first trip to Paris extra special. Would definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “A shout-out of thanks to Stephane and Pierre-Luc”
Reviews.Author: kmw0832
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent six glorious days at Les Jardins de la Villa on our first visit to Paris. As others have commented, the hotel is very stylish and comfortable and the staff is top-notch. The hotel location was great--close to both the Metro and RER lines--everything we wanted to see was very accessible. I felt very comfortable in the neighborhood which is outside of primary tourist spots--sure, you may not have the ambiance of the Latin Quarter, but our most delightful "local" encounters were just outside our hotel. In particular--we enjoyed eating dinner at lively Cafe La Maison which you can find on the walk to the Argentine Metro stop (on the circle). I cannot end this review without a special note of thanks to Stephane. He always greeted us with a warm smile and cheerful interest in our comings and goings, despite working many long days at the front desk. Thanks also to the concierge, Pierre-Luc, who helped us navigate the city and discover the best of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, fabulous week in Paris”
Reviews.Author: amiabledwarf
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise for my girlfriend and she absolutely loved it. The hotel itself is beautiful and very elegantly designed. The staff are attentive and do everything possible to ensure that your stay is as pleasant as possible. We loved the fact that they placed chocolates and scent on our pillows and they even bring you the weather forecast for the following day. The room, although not massive was spotlessly clean and the bathroom immaculate.... with the best shower I have ever experienced. Every detail has been thought of, from the coffee machine in the room, to the safe and the slippers and bath robes. We used the sauna on one occasion and were very impressed that the communal areas were just as clean and well designed as the rooms. The hotel is located right on line one of the metro so getting about is very easy, although I would consider staying slightly more central on another trip to Paris. It takes about 45 minutes to walk to the Eiffel Tower, 15 minutes to the Arc De Triomph and and hour and 15 minutes to city centre, however the metro will get you to the centre in about 10 minutes. All in all I cannot fault the hotel in any way and rest assured you will not be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortably chic”
Reviews.Author: Laura_M46
Reviews.Content: After traveling 13 hours from Asia and arriving at the hotel very early in the morning, I received a warm welcome from Chris, who took care of my every need until my room was ready -- set me up on a computer in the chic and beautiful lounge area, got me hot cappucino and cold drinks, and made sure my room was ready for me very quickly. How lovely! The hotel is chic, trendy, and very well decorated yet comfortable and homey at the same time. Service is attentive and personalized. We enjoyed the convenience and relative calm of the neighborhood -- a good mix of all you need when you walk out on the street without all the hustle and bustle. In all, we thoroughly enjoyed this hotel, and we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem with a warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: salvetat
Reviews.Content: a delightful small hotel in a quiet street right by Porte Maillot, with easy access to all parts of the city by public transport. The staff are outstanding and the welcome is warm and personalised - we were unfailingly given a name whenever they greeted us. Our room was well appointed (though I don't expect a waterproof mattress cover in a 4* hotel!) and extremely comfortable, with a walk-in shower in the bathroom and a small balcony. The breakfast buffet was excellent, but at nearly twice the price of that in equivalent hotels, I was not surprised to see other guests going out to the nearest boulangerie for bread and croissants, especially as there is a Nespresso machine in every room. We felt pampered and extremely well looked after.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel that cossets its guests in the most delightful way”
Reviews.Author: Cantabrigian98
Reviews.Content: A magnificent find. An oasis of calm but with easy access to the rest of Paris from nearby Porte Maillot. This is not a hotel with a view, but once you step inside, you are cocooned from the world. The building has been cleverly converted by an imaginative architect. The rooms and public areas are comfortable and well appointed with an attractive black and silver decor throughout. The breakfast room has a ceiling that rolls back to reveal the sky on a sunny day. The staff are exceptionally welcoming and give the impression (in Paris!) that they are genuinely pleased to have you as their guests. The breakfast buffet (€27) might seem expensive and does not go beyond the usual hot and cold items found in hotels of this category, but the quality is high. We spent two very restful nights and particularly appreciated the spacious walk-in shower.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent surprise”
Reviews.Author: gudmgunna
Reviews.Content: Chose the hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not dissapointed! 4 nights. Rooms small, but elegant.Service personal, only 33 rooms. Situated on a quiet side street. Closely situated to a metro, but also easy to walk to nearby attraction etc. Arch de Triumph. A small quartyard with a "honesty bar" for an afternoon, early evening drink. Definetly a hotel I would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Wonderful place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: dalelove
Reviews.Content: I chose Les Jardins solely from the reviews on Tripadvisor and it proved to be a great choice. It was our first time in Paris and we couldn't have had a nicer hotel or location. We arrived early in the morning and our room wasn't ready but the hotel staff were so helpful in allowing us to leave our luggage, made us coffee and gave us a map and directions. Thanks so much to Chris and Arnaud who made us feel so welcome on arrival! We went for a five minute walk turned a corner and there was the Arc! Our deluxe room was so beautiful! We had a balcony overlooking a lovely candle lit garden and also french doors from the huge marble bathroom. The nespresso machine, the nightly sleep spray for the pillows, the spiced chocolates, the comfy bed the list just of wonderful things just goes on. The neighbourhood was great, lots of cafes...Try Le Congres for a great breakfast and Angelinas in Palais de Congres across the road for wonderful desserts. We honestly cannot praise this hotel enough. Don't hesitate to book. We will be going back next year. Thanks everyone there for making this such a special holiday for us!!!

Reviews.Title: “A special place, both people, as the hotel”
Reviews.Author: luiz62
Reviews.Content: Situated close to some major attractions and the subway, this hotel makes life easier for tourists who want to move quickly and meet the largest possible number of attractions. The professional team is very efficient and friendly. Every time I needed support as logistical as with dinner reservations or concerts, we were very well attended. The decor is modern, the breakfast very good, no hype. My wife did not feel well during the night and needed a doctor, in less than 30 minutes they provided a service. We recommend this hotel for everybody who want to be very well attended.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessLia055
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the Easter weekend this year. This hotel is totally amazing! no other words! the rooms are a good size, the bathroom great, service wonderful and the people were great. the location was also very good - maybe 10 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysee. its a really beautiful hotel and the area was also very nice with restaurants and some night life. We had a really good stay - wish we had stayed longer! will DEFINITELY come back here - it was really great!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: chstiefel
Reviews.Content: It was not the first time way stayed at an SLH. It was as always very cosy and charming - excellent service and friendly staff. I would highly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: INFINITITRAVEL
Reviews.Content: Small but great quality. The wife loved it! I would definitely stay here again next time I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Gerhard79
Reviews.Content: To summarize it: the stay in the hotel was simply perfect. The staff was extremely friendly and caring from the concierge to the porter. They also cared about the small things e.g. chocolate on the pillow, weather forecast etc. The whole hotel is very charming and is nicely decorated. Rooms are big enough and feel very comfortable and relaxing and very clean. I had a room with a balcony, which I really enjoyed. Also nice: every room is equipped with a Nespresso machine and capsules and tea for free. You can also get coffee and tea in the lobby for free the whole day. Wi-Fi was included and available at the room. The hotel is situated next to “Le Palais des Congres” (2 min walk) which contains the conference facility and lots of shops as well as M1 (Port Maillot) with which you can directly reach the city center. Thx for the great time I had.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, lovely, luxurious and comfy!”
Reviews.Author: BibliOphelia
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff, lovely little jewel box rooms, great bath and shower, quiet neighborhood with great boulangerie and bistros and brasseries, convenient to Plaza d'Etoile. Easy trip from Charles de Gaulle.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartinBirmingham038
Reviews.Content: I took my wife here for a romantic break, we stayed for 4 nights and couldn't fault a thing. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable, with free films, and thoughtful touches like chocolate in the evening. Excellent service, we really felt looked after by all the hotel staff especially Ludovic who could not do enough for us. The breakfast was excellent. They have an honesty bar, the first time we had ever seen that. Located on a very quiet street. Very comfy bed. We slept very well. What more can you say. No 1 hotel for a romantic weekend in Paris. We will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: PWan2011
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a week in Paris, Hotel staffs and services were exceeding our expectations, excellent experience, caring staffs speak fluent English, located in quiet corner but walking distance to Arc de triomphe and champs elysées. I will definately return to "Les Jardins de la Villa" on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly niche hotel in Paris - fantastic room and service”
Reviews.Author: TheGees17
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel just before meeting up with our family in Disney Paris. The location is central just a 10 minute walk to the centre of Paris. A great area to wander and some fabulous restaurants close by. The hotel staff were very friendly, helpful and gave excellent directions whenever we wanted to go directly to an area. The breakfasts were delicious and it was a quiet but relaxing atmosphere the whole time we were there. The rooms were gorgeous, well equipped and nothing was too much trouble for any staff member. We were so impressed that we are booking again for July for our next meet in Disney.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel... a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: bjorkkk
Reviews.Content: i've stayed at this hotel for a romantic weekend at the end of march and i've been very positively impressed. hotel has been recently renovated, with cool design and attention to details. the staff has been very friendly, and this is not so common in paris! rooms are larger compared to average, and have very nice and clean bathrooms. breakfast is also very good, and includes biological food. hotel is just within walking distance from metro and RER. compared to other places in paris, it is definitively a very good choice, the price is adequate to the services offered, i would surely recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect new hotel in Paris with all the right features : great location, modern rooms and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: KatiaDR
Reviews.Content: discovered this hotel through a booking website because of the good price - and indeed, price/quality this is an excellent hotel that surprises in multiple fields : the rooms are spotless, nice size for Paris and perfect decoration, the staff is the friendliest and most professional I have ever seen for a small hotel, and the location is perfect, only 15 minutes walk from the Champs Elysees/arc de Triomphe. Coming home from a walk, night service with chocolates on the bed etc, free wireless,... breakfast is the weak point - it is in the lounge area with lounge seats so bit weird in the morning, but in the evening really nice that lounge area and the honesty bar, which gives it again a personal twist. Definately going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - especially if you use the metro”
Reviews.Author: THN_DK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in March - and it is a great hotel, close to the metro, nice area with shops and restaurants close by. The only comment we have is that the beds were a bit on the soft side for our liking. However, this is a personal preference and does not reflect badly on the hotel. Rooms are not bit (we are in Paris after all) - but the hotel is nicely done, very modern bath room and a very advanced gym downstairs (the Technogym Kenetics wall is something which we have only seen very few places - and it works very well). The breakfast may at first seem limited if you expect the classical breakfast buffet - however do take time to enjoy and you will see that the products are all first class, and the staff will refill on an ongoing basis. Compared with other 4- and 5-star properties it is fully comparable. Also: the hotel has a selfservice, honesty bar which is great for that afternoon drink/coffee before venturing out for a nice dinner. The hotel is 3 minutes walk from the metro - so do consider buying a daypass for the metro. For dinner there is a number of options close by - however the "Ballon des Ternes" which was recommended by the hotel (http://www.groupe-menut.com/BallonDesTernes/) is soo good that we actually went there twice during our short stay - the seafood is great and the steaks are very well done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goldbern
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. Great Service and great Rooms. We will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DussevKalin
Reviews.Content: For what would be considered a boutique hotel in the US, the place is nicely designed with modern features. Great breakfast, super evening honor bar with good snacks, wonderful in room ammenities, great location for Congres Hall guests, No restaurant after breakfast. The metro is a 5 minute walk away. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: estrellita03
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel when, with less than a week to go, it is situated really close to the Porte Maillot subway station. The hotel design is fantastic - perfect and of the highest taste and fashion. It is a small hotel so lobby serves as a lounge, and a place where free internet stations with 22" screens are located, and a dining room for breakfast - nicely furnished with very comfortable couches - perfect place to spend an hour in eve after walking through Paris.I will definitely book here again for my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarlosZuloaga
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we found that we had been booked into a double room rather than a twin. The guy on reception could not have been more helpful and although all the twins were gone offered us a second double room at a reduced rate. The hotel is great: recently renovated nice rooms, comfortable beds, clean bathroom, nice staff, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: juicyfullondon
Reviews.Content: If boutique hotels with style and great service are your thing you can't go wrong with this little gem in Paris. I choose this hotel based on other reviews which proved accurate in their praise. I booked through booking.com whose rates were the cheapest, even beating the hotel when I initially phoned to book directly. As we were keen to sample Paris's gastronomic delights we did not breakfast or take room service at the hotel put both looked extensive and well priced. Unfortunately we did not manage to squeeze in the use of the sauna/steam/ fitness room, although we did inspect and were impressed by how well equipped and clean it all was. Our room was small, but I had anticpated this being a city hotel, and it was more than adequate. Nice touches in the turn down service and a choice of free on demand movies. Would not hesitate to recommend or stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, especially compared to similar ones in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Leucanthemum2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three weeks on business. I was worried about staying in one place for such a long period of time, but Les Jardins was very clean, well-located for my purposes and has comfortably-sized rooms. My only complaint was in regards to the schedule of housekeeping and their respect for the "Privacy" sign. They cleaned the room at different times every day. On several occasions, I would return at 3 or 4pm for a nap after a long work day, and the room had not been cleaned. Well, that's okay, but even if I put the privacy sign on the door, they would knock and/or call to see if I wanted my room cleaned. It kind of defeats the purpose of the "Privacy" sign. I did tell them about this when I checked out, so hopefully they will be more respectful of future guests. Other than this, though, it was a very nice small-ish hotel. The beds were very comfortable, and the blackout curtains were great. They also have Nespresso machines in the rooms. The hotel is conveniently located near the Porte Maillot 1-line metro stop. Another reviewer mentioned that taxis don't know Rue Belidor, so to tell them to take you to Meridian Etoile, the big hotel right around the corner. I definitely found this to be true.

Reviews.Title: “An achingly trendy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: N18MER
Reviews.Content: Les Jardins de la Villa is a beautiful, if very arty hotel. It has been designed and built to the 'n'th degree of 'boutique-ness' (such a word?), more, it seems to show off the interior designers' skills. That's not to say it wasn't a very beautiful realisation; it was. Our 'superior' room was a tad small and the bathroom not very sound-proofed :-) but it was so very comfortable. It took a little bit to work out the lighting controls and the TV - which though telling us had English language programmes really only presented world news stations and not UK TV programming or SKY(UK). The breakfast buffet was really, really good. That said, I do appreciate if the waiter anticipates my need for salt and pepper and fetches it for me, rather than leaving me to seek it out because it was missing from the table. The hotel is in a very good location and the shopping centre under the Palais des Congres is a definite plus, as far as my wife is concerned. In summary then, an all too short a stay in a beautiful hotel that can still find room for improvement, but one we enjoyed very much. I would recommend it to my wealthier friends. :-)

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Lovtscho
Reviews.Content: a real nice place with friendly service! You can not stay much better in Paris. And definatley not for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but location not great”
Reviews.Author: prince3080
Reviews.Content: hotel is great, friendly staff , nice rooms, free in room movies the only downside is the location its a good 15 min walk to anything that resembles tourist area if your ok with that then its well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “It's true, this hotel is a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: 4Jem
Reviews.Content: I had a bit of a problem, I needed to go to Paris on business but didn't want to stay in the regular and uninspiring "business" type hotels. I wanted good service, comfort and a decent breakfast in the morning. This hotel was recommended to me by Amercian Express travel and, having read a few good reviews, I decided to book. Shortly before leaving for the airport, I decided to check exactly which tube station I needed to get off at and so had another look at the details of the hotel, which led me back to trip advisor. This time a read a few negative reviews - especially about the uninspiring and small breakfast offer! It was too late to choose anywhere else and, I suspected, these reviews were not quite true. When I arrived at the hotel, I was in a rush to check in as I was late for an appointment. Being behind 3 very fussy ladies who wouldn't agree to leave an imprint of their charge cards (to guarantee their payment but not to pay) did not help. Once I managed to talk to Michael, I explained that I was in a rush and, in a lightning fast speed I was checked in and up in my room where I left my bags. First impressions were that this is a small, friendly hotel with a most amazing attention to detail and cleanliness. True, the rooms are small but are beautifully decorated and have everything and anything in terms of facilities that you could wish for. You even get a levender spray for your pillow which helps whisk you off to sleep in a beautifully comfortable bed. The next morning was the real test - breakfast. Well, I arrived down to breakfast to find a basket full of croissants and pastries on my table, a wonderful assortment of tea and, on request, a lovely cup of coffee. I then went over to the seperate help yourself food area and poured a glass of freshly squeezed orange juice - beautiful! I then helped myself to a fruit salad, becond sausage and scrambled eggs and another glass of orange juice. I didn't take a fresh yoghurt or and toast, cereal or meusli but, as you can see, can not complain about anything relating to the breakfast! I cannot find any fault with this hotel whatsoever and, with the George V, Ritz and Shangri La's costing approx three times more there is simply no copmparison! To be frank, when I return to Paris with my family, even if these larger hotels are a similar price, I will choose Les Jardins de La Villa without question.

Reviews.Title: “Magical!”
Reviews.Author: Ebony_O
Reviews.Content: Every positive review is a true reflection of this beautiful hotel. My partner and i booked a superior room for a 2 nights break in Paris for my birthday. We were immeadiately upgraded to a double deluxe as a gift. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by Michael who was extremely polite, helpful and very freindly. This boutique hotel (which is less than a year old) is small and intimate. It has a small gym, a sauna and a steam room. The rooms are beautifully decorated with perfect attention to detail. It is in a great location. It is 20 minutes from Gare du Nord station and cost 12e in a taxi. The Champs Elysees is less than a 20 minute walk and The Effifel Tower is no more than 15e in a taxi. I spent hours researching different hotels in Paris, reading every review. Do not hestitate to book this hotel you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa_S_Crespo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! Everything is perfect! I had such a wonderful stay there! The hotel design is modern, the rooms are small but confortable and beautiful, great location (feel blocks from Champs Elysees), tastefull breakfast... But definetely what makes the difference is the staff members.. All of them were very gentle, always ready to help us with some restaurant advices, calling a taxi or whatelse...

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Paris gem with amazing services and great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler44109
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to Paris and check in into the hotel the service and staff was unbelievably helpful and attentive right from the start. The concierges there were the most helpful and friendliest that I have seen. Being a traveler from the United States we did not speak fluent French, only the basics and the entire staff made us feel right at home and treated us with the most respect. The hotel is very trendy in its décor and styling and it is a smaller hotel (30 rooms) so you get more of a personalized service. The room was very adequate for its size and the bathroom was great for Paris as a whole. You have a separate bathroom fully enclosed which we found is not always the case in a lot of hotels in Paris. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. Although there were only 2 of us in the room, if you have more than 2 you might want to upgrade to another room that is larger in size and the hotel is very helpful and you can email them and they can walk you through your options that you might not find on the website. I would and will definitely stay here again. Also, the location of the hotel is great and located near the Metro. The hotel is hidden so you might want to get detailed directions or carry a GPS to find it as it is a hidden gem and tucked away from everything. I really can't say anything bad about the hotel from my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Small is Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Jem008
Reviews.Content: A special privately run hotel with attention to detail and delightfully helpful staff. The rooms are small but they are beautifully presented with some really nice touches e.g. nespresso coffee machine in every room, conditioner in the bathroom (not just the usual shampoo), chocolates in the evening and a daily weather card by your bed. Spotlessly clean, sound proofed rooms, comfortable beds and well located for the Champs Elysee. Contemporary style but still cosy. Recommended without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: L-SUSMAN
Reviews.Content: I have only just returned from a wonderful stay at Les Jardins de la Villa and already wanting to return. The decor is beautiful and very welcoming. The honesty bar is a great idea and makes you feel right at home. The bedroom was very comfortable and clean. The best part of the hotel was just how friendly the concierge where. I would recommend this hotel happily and thank the team for my great stay

Reviews.Title: “A constant flow of pleasant surprises”
Reviews.Author: Mr_ABZ_Gray
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Paris but have never been so delighted with what I found at this hotel. The staff are friendly. The rooms though small are exceedingly well finished and furnished. An example are the blackout curtains which were obviously chosen to fit the arrangement of the windows and as a consequence were much more effective than the usual hotel fare. Breakfasts at French hotels are best missed. Not here. A good selection of top quality breads, fruits and cheeses plus the usual hot items. I only wish I could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HampshireHighlife
Reviews.Content: What a find ! I would definitely come back to this beautiful little hotel. A hidden gem in Paris in a perfect location. The rooms are spotless with beautiful bedding, bathrooms and toiletries, fluffy towels and lovely robes. Our room (number 40) had the biggest bath I have ever seen ! The decor is very quirky and fits the hotel perfectly and the attention to detail was outstanding. There is the sweetest honesty bar with complementary fruit and pastries tea and coffee. There is also a lovely little spa area and gym room that we did not have time to use but looked great. All the staff were absolutely amazing and nothing was to much trouble, all so friendly and very helpful. Blaise in particular was wonderful - Our flights home were cancelled and he could see that my friend and I were flapping about trying to get ourselves home with not much luck. He sat with us and arranged everything ! booking us both seats on Euro Star and arranging taxi's - calming us down from our panic ! - a perfect gentleman and we cant thank him enough for all he did for us. What an asset for the hotel to have staff like this. This is an amazing little hotel perfect for a city or a romanic break and I cant think of one negative thing - I will coming back ! 100% perfect.

Reviews.Title: “:-) Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Malvolti
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small BUT beautifull and clean!!! Staff really kind and friendly!!! Free internet that works perfect! Location i found it's okay! 10min walking to the champs E. It's a small beautifull hotel... If we come back to paris for buisness or pleasure we would take the same hotel! Little bit expensive for small room...

Reviews.Title: “A great choice and wonderful place to stay when in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PerTan
Reviews.Content: Great choice which we selected for our honeymoon stay based on trip advisor reviews. It has an excellent location, 2min from the metro and the Palace Congress (Very Upscale Mall) and 7min walk from the Arc de Triumph, and 20min walk to the Eiffel Tower. Close to the main street where lots of restaurants are with a choice of cuisine. There are convenient stores within 2min if you want fresh fruit and need to go to the pharmacy. The staff, oh wow, wonderful. Very attentive in every important way for a visitor and not over-bearing. The ambiance, oh soooo nice. Sophisticated and yet warm and inviting. Out bathroom was exceptional. The room was small relative to American standards, but wonderfully modern and sexy. Unlimited tea, coffee and snacks. My husband used the gym and sauna and rained praises. The only item on the wish list are movie/entertainment channels in English. The only English speaking channels are news channels. If you have never been to Paris, don't fear you will be making a good choice with this one!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveler2020
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this small boutique hotel as part of our belated honeymoon in Paris. We were very happy during the first few days of our stay. The location was nice and the rooms were very uniquely decorated. The service seemed okay until the end of our trip, when two things went wrong. First, my iPod disappeared from our room. Second, our laundry bag full of clothes (which we put outside the room as per the instructions of the hotel staff) disappeared. This was all very disconcerting to us. We complained to the hotel manager, who became very defensive about how their staff would never steal anything. They blamed us for putting the laundry outside, although we were specifically told to do so. The hotel promised that they would look into the matter and get back to us. After repeated emails over the next FOUR months, the hotel finally reimbursed us for the iPod, but did not do anything about the laundry. They also accused us of making a stain on a lamp in the room, which we are certain we did not do and which we ourselves noticed when we arrived. I'm a frequent traveler and have never had such a bad experience with customer service at a hotel before. I definitely would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “sweet hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: johnmdlm
Reviews.Content: this hotel is placed on a perfect location and its very easy to reach the main things form there via metro. metro station is placed only few minutes from the hotel. Hotel stuff was extremly friendly, attentive and charming. the only problem can be the size of the room, in case you care about it- we dont. as well, sometimes the interney connection can be slow, but overall we had a great stay there. plus, around the area you ll find a lot of nice bars and restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed...”
Reviews.Author: TravelHamster
Reviews.Content: So for a 2 week break in Paris this was a great choice. It's 10 mins from the Arc de Triomphe and 3 mins from a tube station with good links to most of Paris. Like all who have gone before have stated, the service is top notch; very welcoming, very accomodating. We stayed on a freezing cold weekend when it didnt stop raining and Les Jardins was a great respite from the misery outside! Couple of cracking little restaurants in the 17th as well - proper French Cuisine; simple and very well done.Sadly, I cant remember their names! Downside, the rooms are small but that doesnt REALLY matter.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but tiny room”
Reviews.Author: VSS13
Reviews.Content: The service is really great but the rooms are very tiny even for European standards even the upgraded rooms. The manager is really great and checks on you everyday. Clean rooms. Enjoyed my stay

Reviews.Title: “Chic, comfortable hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: RamblingMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for a long weekend. It is a small, but elegant hotel. The attention to detail is terrific. The room we stayed in (superior) was very small, but well designed and included everything you would need. Close to Metro. It was pricey at over €300 a night, and for that we did not even get breakfast, But everything in Paris is pricey. Overall a very pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Attention paid to every detail - fanciest hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: croelin1000
Reviews.Content: Wow, this hotel pays attention to every little detail. It's a small hotel (only 28), which I think is why they go all out. Everything is nice, from the sheets, bed, towels, to the tiny touches like chocolate and pillow spray every night. Stayed here for 2 wks for a work trip, and loved going back every night. I also happened to have one of the larger rooms, I believe, because my coworkers rooms were all smaller than mine. Two of my colleagues had trouble connecting to the internet from their rooms, but two of us were fine. Would definitely stay again for work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Martin7244
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this hotel for a short break. The rooms are nice, al little small but very nice decorated and a excellent bathroom. The hotel is quite, beds are very good and breakfast was superb for Paris, free of charge breakfast on the room. I've been in many top-rated hotels and the service of the concierge and staff was the best I've ever seen. Nothing was too much. Everything to make you feel happy.

Reviews.Title: “Funky place”
Reviews.Author: Pommi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business in October 2010. This hotel is VERY convenient for the Air France Bus from Roissy CdG which dropped me about 100 metres from the hotel for about 17 EU. Service was great and the rooms very well equipped and trendy. I was a bit shocked to see a small packet of Tyrells crisps on offer in the minibar for just 7 Euros, but maybe I just don't get out enough :-). I managed not to eat them . The room had a shower but not a bath. The shower was great though big dish head with loads of water. Quality toiletries as you'd expect at this exalted price level. The bed was fantastically comfortable - one of the best I have had in a hotel. I enjoyed the stay but would have enjoyed it far more without the fire alarm at half past midnight, caused apparently by another guest smoking in their room. Perhaps it would be unfair to be too critical about that though. If you are looking for a funky boutique hotel this could be the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: artfrk
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to stay in. We booked this hotel upon recommendation from other trip advisor travelers. It was located on a quiet street but near to the metro, a large shopping mall and lots of cafes, restaurants and a large hotel that had a jazz bar. The staff couldn't be nicer. The concierge staff was excellent, we mostly used Blaise who gave wonderful advice and tips. The room was a junior suite and it was perfect. I would stay there again. Thanks for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel but very confortable. We felt like home.”
Reviews.Author: Bida020557
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights during end of september 2010. Very confortable besides the room to be a little bit small. Staffs are excellents and very helpfull for everything. Small, but very good fittnes. Very good breakfast and included in the daily rate. We definitelly recomend this hotel and for sure we will be there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Classic From Small Luxury Hotel Group”
Reviews.Author: ShaunScotland
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here and booked through lastminute which cost 260 euros per night. Breakfast was 25 euros each and car parking was 30 euros a night. So its nae a cheap hotel and its not a run of the mill hotel, its a funky , boutique, classy, romantic hotel. If I had booked it through SLH own web page I would of got the hotel for the same price but would have been upgraded to the next room level. So some times it pays to book direct. We were on the second floor which only had 4 rooms per floor our room number was 25. The first thing I noticed was the thickness and quality of the door so once it was shut it blocked out all the noise, not that there was any. The windows were double glazed so no street noise either and for me one of the best parts was the curtains which over lapped so if you closed them during the day time the blocked out the light completely, most excellent. The furniture in the room was of good quality and the decoration was classy and stylish, Loved it. The bathroom was lined in tiles which looked like they were made of leather and it was fitted with a rain forest shower, loved it. Free WiFi for each room for all the computer people. There was nothing about this hotel that I can fault apart from the price but hey you only live once and you pay for class and quality. We arrived on a friday afternoon and the concierge managed to get us booked into a cabaret show that night and got us front row seats, now that was service to me. Breakfast was nice and trendy and it did have the best omelettes ever, I loved all the little nic nacs for breakie and the big tables that you got to eat at so I could read the paper as I munched down my croissant, loved it. Fantasic place for couples to stay and within easy walking distance to the sites and various bars and cafes. Can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet hotel, if a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: sgjsn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in September. Hotel is in a quiet side street, but near to the Congress centre, Air France bus and Metro. The hotel is very modern and tastefully decorated. The rooms are quite small, but comfortable, with coffee machine, large flat screen TV and modern bathroom facilties. My shower was a bit odd as it had no retaining shower tray and it was difficult to stop water running under the shower curtain all over the floor. The room was quiet and the bed comfy. Only "complaint" was the price eg 27 Euros for breakfast! At this price, most guests pick up a coffee and a croissant from one of the many cafes nearby. Cannot understand why hotels feel they can charge such ridiculous prices for breakfast. But there was free wireless access, which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jasmin20
Reviews.Content: Small hotel but Beautifully designed. Luxurious, quiet, calm, comfortable room. Great amenities & bathrooms. Tiny oasis; the hotel packs a lot of goodies into a small space. I looked forward to returning every evening.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: cstelin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you are spending a long weekend in Paris. I was in one room with my wife (Young Couple); my parents in anothe rroom (over 50s); and my sister was in another room with her husband and baby (Family with young kids). We were all very pleased. It is near all the relevant points in the city, yet it is very quiet at night. The rooms may be tiny, yet they have done wonders with the space layout. Everything fits just right. I highly recommend Les Jardins for a comfortable weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndreMaciel
Reviews.Content: I have styed in this totel by chance. My original booking was on a different otel but due to some problems on my room (and beiing totally full), my original hotel booked a night for me on this one which was not very far from it. The hotel is avery small boutique hotel. The staff was very friendly. The decor is fantastic. The rooms are very cosy. Breakfast is good. You can use the haman/sauna if you request at reception (I did not have the chance to enjoy it). The location is good (near Arch Triomphe) but not the best in Paris. Overall a very good stay. Am hotel which I would definetely recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Booking Problem”
Reviews.Author: footnotesetc
Reviews.Content: This is a review on the hotel's booking policy, not a hotel stay. I booked on the hotel's website. The hotel booking policy on the website is that a credit card is necessary to book and guarantee a reservation. Common policy! NOT on the booking policy, was a "one night charge", immediate upon booking stipulated. (This would have been all right with me, but it should be stated on the website.) So I was taken by surprise when my credit card company called to inform me of the booking charge. Recalling this was not required for the booking, I instructed my credit card company to reject the charge. Since then, I emailed twice to ask about this, but received no reply. I emailed another two times to ask for a confirmation of my reservation, but no reply. In my opinion this leaves me with an extremely poor impression. I had no alternative but to cancel this reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: JEPWalsall
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a romantic weekend in Paris and, having read all the reviews, we ended up staying at this lovely hotel. Deserves to be highly rated and we'd certainly have no problems returning to the hotel again in the future. Staff all friendly and helpful. Location ideal. (Air France drop off just 2 mins walk away!) Can't recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: Knights82
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel for my first night in Paris and was glad I found the place. For what would be considered a boutique hotel in the US, the place is nicely designed with modern features. Room included free Wi-Fi and the bathroom was even normal-sized by US standards. Staff was both pleasant and helpful. The only downside on the place was the price. I understand midweek rates can be higher, but $300+ for a Wednesday night seemed pretty high to me. 21 Euro for breakfast is a bit much as well. I'll gladly stay here on future visits, but will check further in advance to catch a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stylish Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Max Ray
Reviews.Content: Small and well-styled, Les Jardins de la Villa is the perfect business travellers' hotel. Located two minutes walk from Porte Maillot metro station, the hotel is convenient for those visiting the west of Paris and the Champs Elysee area. The purpose of my stay was for business purposes. I stayed only the one night but was very impressed with the quality of the hotel. The rooms are small, as is the hotel in general; I think there are only 4 rooms per floor over five floors. The first thing that strikes you in the modern, clean and stylish decor. From the "busts" in the hallways to the styling of the rooms and bathrooms, the attention to detail is worthy of note. I enjoyed a single room on the fifth floor. The room was petite, but was well-equipped with wide screen tv, mini bar and complimentary wi-fi internet access. Best of all, the room and bathroom appeared to be brand new. I made use of the honesty bar on the ground floor, but thought it was a little poorly stocked. Again, the design of the dining/living room was fantastic. I used the gym also. Again, it appeared brand new and almost unused, and despite its size, it was well equipped with a range of aerobic equipment. There was a small selection of light weights and there was a sauna and communal shower area also. Perfect for the average gym user and a business person, such as I, who is looking for a little early morning exercise. I did not take breakfast at the hotel, and due to its comparatively high cost (27 Euros!), I chose to dine at one of the many nearby Parisian coffee houses. All in all, I thought this hotel was great and I will chose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: Euro-Biz-Traveller
Reviews.Content: I selected Les Jardins De La Villa for two reasons: It was recommended by business travellers on Tripadvisor, and I found the right price on Expedia. In short, next time I'm in Paris on business, this is where I'll stay. The hotel is small, friendly, cozy and perfectly located, close to a major subway/underground station and within easy walking distance from the airport bus stop. Free internet and quality coffee (and tea) in the room. Some of the rooms are quite small, this is Paris after all, but others are roomy. The style (black and pink colours were prominent in my room) may not be to everyone's liking, but it grew on me. Other rooms have colour schemes that are more neutral.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, friendly staff & large room by Paris standards! :)”
Reviews.Author: BussLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great spot for me, a 2 minute walk from Palais des Congres. The hotel is in a small side street so no noise yet close to plenty of restaurants. One of the few hotels with a gym, not massive, but they had a treadmill, bike, cross trainer and hand weights all technogym with the wall pulley system. The hotel was extremely clean and well finished and felt more like a home than hotel. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: leeson28
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in hotels in Paris before around the same price as this one, this is definately the best one so far, we had breakfast included in the price and it was great. The catered for the Overseas traveller at breakfast , and had English Breakfast on the menu as well. Lovely comfortable beds (the only critisim was the underblanket which was partly plastic and unfortunately made you perspire in the night. Lovely staff especially the indian gentleman in the breakfast room, nothing was too much trouble for him. Smallish roooms but this star of hotel in Paris always is, if you want larger rooms you will pay twice the amount.Around 20 minute walk to the Arc de triomphe, but you can take the metro which is just down the road to all locations or a taxi ride. Would recommend that you book a room at the rear of the hotel as the street noise during the night was bad, if you wanted the windows open for fresh air. It has airconditioning and double galzed windows so you can shut the windows and therefor the noise out if you want to. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Simonpk
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel. A place you look forward to going back to after a day full of shopping. Small and cozy. The rooms are great, the bathrooms are luxurious, the Honesty Bar is great. Service is great (that goes for all except one of the staff). I don't think they have a big kitchen, so don't expect much when it comes to room service. Some dishes seemed like they had been in the microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irynaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in March, loved Hotel very much. Great breacfast, friendly helpful staff, just perfect place

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mjamme
Reviews.Content: I was amazed with this Hotel. The hotel is lovely, looks ideal for romantics, peaceful and really clean. You have a tidy bed before you go to sleep, chocolate in your bed etc... Really nice! I like and will come again!

Reviews.Title: “This is a real luxary but with personal touch”
Reviews.Author: Kesoyser
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever been to. The hotel design is fantastic - perfect and of the highest taste and fashion. It is a small hotel so lobby serves as a lounge, and a place where free internet stations with 22" screens are located, and a dining room for breakfast - nicely furnished with very comfortable couches - perfect place to spend an hour in eve after walking through Paris. Rooms are big enough (for Paris - very big!) and our room had a huge bathroom with large two-door window. Everything is brand-new and not just clean - "Monica-clean" (if you are familiar with Friends TV show). Espresso coffee machine in a regular room (included into room rate) - never seen it before! Downstairs coffee and tea are also available 24 hours free of charge. Bar is self-serviced, which gives it really personal touch - you just take whatever drinks you want and report them after. The hotel also has a very nice little garden and fitness with sauna (I did not use fitness). Overall it is amazing how ALL little things and details are well-thought through and delivered in a special way.
